Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a girl named Sue. Sue loved to play with her round ball. One day, while playing outside, the sky became dark. Sue knew it was time to go inside.
Sue's mom saw the dark sky too. She said, "Sue, come inside. We might receive rain soon." Sue listened to her mom and went inside with her round ball.
As they sat inside, Sue and her mom received a surprise. They heard a knock on the door. When they opened it, they saw a little boy with a round ball too. He said, "Hi, I'm Tim. Can I play with you?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, let's play when the dark sky is gone." And they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play soccer with his friends. They would play every day at the stadium near their house.
Timmy was always impatient to win the game. He wanted to be the best player and score the most goals. But Timmy didn't practice enough to improve his skills.
One day, Timmy's team was playing against another team. Timmy was so impatient that he didn't listen to his coach's instructions. He ran too fast and fell down. He hurt his leg and couldn't play anymore.
Timmy's team lost the game because they didn't have their best player. Timmy learned that he needed to practice more and be patient if he wanted to improve. From that day on, he worked hard to become a better player.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved music and was always curious about new songs. One day, her parents took her to a music store. She saw a shiny red box with a picture of a guitar on it. Lily was so curious about what was inside the box that she asked her parents to buy it.
When they got home, Lily couldn't wait to unpack the box. She opened it and found a guitar inside. She was so happy and started playing it right away. But then, her little brother came and wanted to play with it too. Lily didn't want to share and they started arguing. 
Their parents heard the commotion and came to see what was going on. They explained to Lily that it's important to share and take turns. Lily realized she was being selfish and let her brother play too. They ended up having fun playing music together. From that day on, Lily learned to share and be less curious about keeping things to herself.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and explore the world around her. One day, she found a dirty bulb in her garden. She decided to pick it up and show it to her mom.
Her mom told her that the bulb could be used to grow a beautiful flower. So, Lily planted the bulb in a pot and watered it every day. She was very excited to see what kind of flower would grow.
After a few weeks, the flower started to bloom. But something unexpected happened. The flower was not the kind Lily was expecting. It was a strange and unusual plant. So, Lily decided to test it and see what would happen. She touched the plant and suddenly, it started to glow! Lily was amazed and happy to have discovered something so magical. From that day on, she knew that even dirty bulbs could lead to something wonderful.

Once upon a time there was a big blue box. Inside the box was a hammer. A bunny was also looking at the big blue box.
The bunny asked, “what’s in the box?” The box said, “I have a hammer inside.”
The bunny thought it was fun, so he took the hammer and ran away to hide. But the bunny was not so tidy, so he left the box open.
The bunny hid in a flowerpot and laughed. He said, “This is a good spot to hide the hammer!”
But then a giant bear suddenly appeared, and said, “What are you doing? That’s my hammer, give it back now! Give it back or else!”
The bunny looked so scared. But he remembered that if he was tidy, then he wouldn’t have gotten into this trouble. So he quickly put the hammer back into the box and closed it.
The bear checked that the box was tidy and then he smiled. He said, “Well done! I know you won’t hide it again.”
And the bunny said, “I promise I won’t.”

Once upon a time, there was a tall tree. It was very big and strong. Two birds lived in the tree. One bird was red and the other was blue.
One day, the red bird and the blue bird had a quarrel. They were not happy with each other. They both wanted the same branch to sit on. They did not want to share.
Then, a wise old owl came to the tall tree. The owl knew the truth. He told the red bird and the blue bird to be friends and share the branch. The red bird and the blue bird listened to the owl. They stopped the quarrel and became friends again. They sat on the branch together and were happy.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park with her mom. Amy wore her favorite skirt. It was pink with flowers. She loved to play in the park.
Amy saw a big tree with pretty flowers. She wanted to pick some for her mom. "Mom, can I pick the flowers?" she asked. "Yes, Amy, but be careful," her mom said.
Amy tried to pick the flowers, but she fell and hurt her knee. It made her sad. Her mom hugged her and said, "It's okay, Amy. You will feel better soon." They went home, and Amy's mom put a band-aid on her knee. Amy felt better and gave her mom the flowers she picked.

Once upon a time, there was a big park with lots of trees and flowers. One day, a group of friends went to the park for a tour. They walked around and saw many things like birds and bugs. One friend said, "Let's stand under this tree and rest for a bit." They all agreed and stood together. 
After a while, they saw a lady with a big bag. She came up to them and said, "Hello friends, would you like to join my organized tour of the park?" They were excited and said yes. The lady led them to many cool places in the park and showed them things they had never seen before. 
At the end of the tour, they thanked the lady and said goodbye. They all agreed that it was a fun day and they couldn't wait to come back to the park again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat yummy things. One day, his mommy made a big, yummy cake. Tim was excited to eat the cake later.
While Tim was playing, his friend Sam came over. They played with their toys and had fun. Tim said, "Mommy made a yummy cake for us to eat later!" Sam was excited too. Tim's mommy heard them and thought of a fun idea.
Tim's mommy came to them and said, "I have a fun game for you. I will hide the cake, and you have to find it!" Tim and Sam liked the idea. They closed their eyes while mommy hid the cake.
They looked and looked but could not find the cake. Sam said, "Let's look in the kitchen." They went to the kitchen, and there was the cake! But it was not a real cake. It was a big, yummy cake made of play-dough! Tim and Sam laughed and played with the play-dough cake. Mommy smiled and said, "Now, let's eat the real yummy cake!" They all sat down and enjoyed the real cake together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to walk in nature. She was very intelligent and loved to learn new things. One day, while walking in the forest, she met a talking squirrel.
"Hello, little girl," said the squirrel. "I see you are very intelligent. Would you like to play a game with me?"
Lily was excited and said, "Yes, please!"
The squirrel led her to a big tree and said, "Let's see who can climb this tree the fastest."
Lily started climbing, but halfway up, she slipped and fell. She hurt her leg badly and couldn't walk anymore. The squirrel disappeared, leaving her alone in the forest.
Lily was scared and started to cry. She wished she had never met the talking squirrel. Suddenly, she heard a voice calling her name. It was her mom who had been looking for her. She was relieved and happy to be found, but she never forgot the lesson she learned that day - to be careful when meeting strangers in nature.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, he heard his big sister playing her guitar. Timmy loved the sound of it and asked his sister if he could play too. She said yes and showed him how to strum the strings. Timmy loved it and played the guitar every day.
One day, Timmy's sister brought home some sweet candy. Timmy loved the candy and ate a lot of it. But then he started to feel sick and didn't like the candy anymore. He told his sister that he hates sweet things now.
But he still loved playing his guitar and practiced every day. He even played a song for his sister and she thought it was great! Timmy was very happy and knew that he would always love playing his guitar.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She wanted to find a star, so she decided to march. She looked everywhere until she found a red star. Then she was so excited. 
She marched towards the star, but when she tried to pick it up, she couldn't. She closed her eyes and wished really hard, but still nothing happened. Then the star started to glow brighter and brighter, until it disappeared. 
The little girl was so sad. She had wanted a star to keep forever. She hit the ground and started to cry. 
The little girl never found a star again. She never forgot that red star in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a young deer who lived in the forest. He loved playing in the sun and running around. But the deer had a problem: he was deaf! He couldn't hear the birds singing in the trees or the wind blowing through the leaves.
One summer day, the deer was feeling very thirsty. He looked for something to drink. He couldn't find anything in the forest so he decided to go for a walk. He soon saw a big lake. He carefully stepped closer to the shore and bent down to drink.
Suddenly, he heard a voice coming from the lake. It was a voice asking him: "Why are you deaf?".
The deer was very surprised and he stepped back. Thinking carefully, he then answered with a gentle voice: "I don't know. I have always been deaf."
He thanked the voice for asking him the question and continued to drink until he was no longer thirsty. The deer returned back to the forest and thanked the lake for listening to his story.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play with her toys. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. They decided to play a game where they had to stand in a line and poke each other gently. Lily was having fun until she accidentally poked her friend too hard.
Her friend started crying and Lily felt sorry. She said, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to poke you so hard." Her friend didn't want to play anymore and went home. Lily was sad because she lost her friend and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, a big bird flew down and landed in front of her. The bird had a note in its beak that said, "I'm sorry too. Let's be friends again." Lily was surprised and happy to see her friend's message. She ran home to write a note back to her friend, and they became friends again. From that day on, they always played together and never poked each other too hard again.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and jump all day long. He had a chain that he liked to play with, but one day, the chain broke.
Spot's mom saw the broken chain and wanted to help. She went to the store to replace the chain with a new one. Spot was so happy when he saw the new chain, he wagged his tail and barked.
But then, something unexpected happened. When Spot's mom gave him the new chain, it turned into a big, bouncy ball! Spot was surprised, but he loved the ball even more than the chain. He played with it all day and had so much fun. And that's how Spot got a new favorite toy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, but she didn't like to clean up when she was done. One day, her mommy told her that if she cleaned up all her toys, she would get a prize. 
Lily was very excited about the prize, so she got ready to clean up. She picked up her dolls, her blocks, and her puzzles. But then she saw her favorite toy, a teddy bear, and she didn't want to put it away. 
Her mommy said, "Lily, you have to clean up all your toys, even your teddy bear." But Lily didn't listen. She decided to ignore her mommy and keep playing with her teddy bear. 
When it was time for bed, Lily remembered the prize and felt sad that she didn't get it. She realized that ignoring her mommy wasn't a good idea and promised to listen next time. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little seed. It was very small and needed to grow. So, it was planted in the ground. 
Every day, the sun would shine and the rain would fall. The little seed started to grow and grow. It became a big, tall plant with lots of leaves. 
One day, a little girl went for a walk in the woods. She saw the big, tall plant and followed the trail it made. The trail was busy with bugs and animals. 
The little girl was happy to find the plant and she knew it would keep growing and growing. The end.

Once upon a time, in a deep forest, there lived a little rabbit named Remy. Remy was a good rabbit and always tried to behave. One day, he met a squirrel named Sam.
"Hi, Sam!" said Remy. "Do you want to play?"
Sam looked at Remy and said, "No, I am looking for a big root to eat. I am very hungry."
Remy wanted to help Sam, so they looked for a root together. They found a big root, but it was stuck in the ground. They both tried to pull it out, but it was too deep.
"Let's ask our friends for help," said Remy. So, they asked their friends, the birds and the mice, to help them. All the animals tried to pull the root, but it was still too deep.
Finally, Remy had an idea. "Let's all behave and work together," he said. All the animals listened to Remy and worked together to pull the root out. With everyone's help, they got the root out and Sam could eat. They all learned that when they behave and work together, they can solve any problem.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet bunny named Snowball who she loved very much. One day, Lily's mommy told her that they were going to a party. Lily was very excited and wanted to bring Snowball with her. 
When they got to the party, Lily saw a big present with a bow on it. It was so big and expensive-looking! Lily wanted to see what was inside, but it was wrapped up tight. Suddenly, Snowball hopped over to the present and started nibbling on the bow. 
Lily was worried that Snowball would get in trouble, but then something unexpected happened. The present started to move! It turned out that someone was hiding inside the box, and they were not happy about Snowball eating the bow. But Lily and her mommy explained that Snowball was just a curious bunny, and they all ended up having a great time at the party.

Once upon a time, there was a little island in the middle of the sea. On this island, there were many animals who were friends. They liked to play and have fun together. One day, a big, tough bird came to the island. The bird wanted to play with the animals, but they were scared because he was so big and tough.
The big, tough bird felt sad. He wanted to be friends with the animals. He asked a wise old turtle for help. The wise old turtle thought for a moment and then said, "I recommend that you try to be gentle and kind. Show the animals that you can be a good friend."
The big, tough bird listened to the wise old turtle. He started to be gentle and kind to the animals on the island. He helped them find food and played games with them. Soon, the animals saw that the big, tough bird was a good friend. They were not scared of him anymore.
From that day on, the big, tough bird and the animals on the island were the best of friends. They played together every day and had lots of fun. The wise old turtle was happy to see that his recommendation had helped the big, tough bird find friends on the island. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a mommy and her daughter. They went for a walk in the park. The daughter was happy and excited to run around. She saw a big slide and wanted to try it. She climbed up the ladder step by step until she got to the top. Then she slid down and felt dizzy but happy. 
After that, they walked some more and saw a big tree. The daughter wanted to climb it. She held onto the branches and stepped up, one by one. She got to the top and looked down at her mommy. She felt proud of herself. 
Finally, they sat down on a bench to rest. The daughter was still a little dizzy from the slide and the tree, but she was happy. She cuddled up to her mommy and they watched the birds fly by. It was a nice day in the park.

John and Mary were eager to watch their favorite video. John had been looking forward to it for days and he was very excited. Mary, however, refused to watch the video. She was very upset and felt like she didn't want to do it. 
John was very mad at Mary for refusing the video. He asked her why she wouldn't watch the video with him. Mary said softly, "I don't want to because I do not feel happy". John looked at her in surprise and asked: "Are you sure? It will make us both happy and we can have fun together".
Mary thought about it for a moment and she realized that John was right. She agreed to watch the video with John. They could both have a good time together and enjoy the video. 
John and Mary learned an important lesson that day: sometimes it's better to go along with others and be willing to do things with them and enjoy yourself instead of refusing to do something and being upset.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a gray cat named Mittens. One day, Lily was walking to the park with Mittens when she stumbled on a rock. 
"Ouch!" cried Lily. 
"What happened?" asked Mittens. 
"I stumbled on a rock," Lily said, rubbing her knee. 
Mittens looked at Lily's knee and saw a small file stuck in it. "Let me help you," he said. Mittens carefully pulled the file out of Lily's knee and gave her a band-aid to put on it. 
"Thank you, Mittens," said Lily. "You're such a helpful cat." 
From that day on, Lily and Mittens went on many more adventures together, but they always made sure to watch out for rocks and files on the ground.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny. The bunny had soft fur that was white as snow. One day, the bunny went for a walk in the forest. The sun was shining bright and the trees looked green and tall. Suddenly, the bunny saw a big carrot in the ground. The bunny wanted to eat it but it was too hard to pull out of the ground. So, the bunny requested help from a friendly squirrel. The squirrel had sharp teeth and was able to pull out the carrot. The bunny was so happy and shared the carrot with the squirrel. They both enjoyed the delicious snack together under the bright sun.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and his dog, Buddy. One day, Timmy found a thing in the park. It was a shiny rock that sparkled in the sun.
Timmy showed the thing to Buddy and said, "Look, Buddy! I found a pretty thing!" Buddy barked happily and wagged his tail.
But then, Timmy had a naughty idea. He said to Buddy, "Let's play a joke on Mommy! We'll hide the thing and see if she can find it."
So, Timmy and Buddy hid the thing under Mommy's pillow. When Mommy came home, Timmy said, "Mommy, we have a surprise for you! Can you find the thing we hid?"
Mommy looked under her pillow and found the thing. But then, she accidentally stepped on Buddy's tail and he bit her. Mommy had to go to the hospital and Timmy felt very sad. He realized that playing jokes can be dangerous and he promised to never do it again.

One day, a little girl named Lucy had a question. She asked her mom, "What is an x-ray?" Mom said, "An x-ray is a special picture that helps doctors see inside our body."
Lucy was very curious. She wanted to see an x-ray picture. So, mom took her to the doctor's office. The doctor showed Lucy an x-ray of an empty box. "This is how an x-ray looks," he said.
Lucy was happy to see the x-ray. She thanked the doctor and went back home with her mom. Now, she knew what an x-ray was and could tell her friends about it.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. He liked to play with his friends. One day, Tom and his friends went to the park. In the park, they saw a man with a big box. The box was full of ice. The ice was in different shapes and colors.
Tom and his friends went to the man and asked, "What is this?" The man said, "This is a special ice. If you say 'please', you can receive one piece." Tom and his friends said, "Please!" The man gave them each a piece of ice.
Tom and his friends played with the ice. They saw that the ice was very cold and fun to touch. They made a game to see who could hold the ice the longest. After a while, the ice started to melt. They laughed and had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to build things with his blocks. He liked to make towers and houses. One day, Timmy wanted to make a pattern with his blocks. He put the red block, then the blue block, and then the yellow block. He did this over and over again until he had a pretty pattern.
But then, something strange happened. Timmy's mom came in and said that something was not normal. She said that the pattern was wrong and that Timmy needed to fix it. Timmy didn't understand. He thought his pattern was pretty. So, he kept it the way it was.
The next day, Timmy's little sister came in and knocked over his tower. All of his blocks fell down and his pretty pattern was ruined. Timmy was sad. He tried to build his tower again, but it wasn't the same. He missed his pretty pattern.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, especially her teddy bear. One day, Lily's mommy told her not to play with her food because it was bad. Lily didn't mind and kept playing with her peas. 
Later that day, Lily went outside to play with her friends. They decided to play tag, but Lily accidentally bumped into her friend and made her cry. Lily felt bad and said sorry. Her friend forgave her and they continued to play happily. 
As the sun began to set, Lily's mommy called for her to come inside. Lily was sad because she didn't want to stop playing. But, she knew it was time to go home and mind her mommy. She went to bed that night with her teddy bear, dreaming of all the fun she would have playing again tomorrow.

Mummy and Daddy took their little girl to the park. She was so adorable in her frilly pink dress. They played all morning, skipping through the grass and laughing in the sunshine.
Suddenly, the sky began to rumble and the clouds opened. It began to rain! The little girl was so scared.
'Don't worry,' said Mummy, 'we have a shelter over here so we can stay dry.'
The little girl followed them to the shelter and as they got closer, she saw something amazing. A fly was caught in the rain. It was flying in circles at incredible speed, staying just out of reach of the raindrops.
The little girl laughed with joy and clapped her hands. 'Look, Mummy, Daddy! It's so wonderful!'
Mummy and Daddy smiled at their little girl with love.
When the rain stopped, the little girl ran out to where the fly had been, but it was gone.
'Where did it go, Mummy?'
'Maybe it went to find a sunnier place,' said Mummy.
The little girl smiled and thought about the fly and its amazing flying.
'I hope it found a good place to stay', thought the little girl. 
And from that day on, she whispered 'Rain, rain, go away! Come again another day. Fly away and find some sun!' whenever the

Once upon a time, there was a white bunny named Snowy. Snowy loved to hop around and play with his friends. One day, Snowy went for a walk in the forest. He saw a big tree and decided to climb it. When he reached the top, he saw a bird's nest. The nest had three little eggs inside.
Snowy was curious and wanted to see the eggs closely. He leaned in, but suddenly the wind blew and he got stuck in the nest! Snowy started to worry and thought he would never get out. But then, he remembered that he had a zipper on his jacket. He quickly unzipped his jacket and was able to wiggle free from the nest. Snowy was so happy and relieved that he ran back to his friends to tell them about his adventure.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a police car. The police car was very organized. It had many things inside. Tim liked the police car a lot.
Tim said to the police, "I want to change my toy car into a police car." The police smiled and said, "You can do that, Tim. Just use your imagination."
So, Tim went home and changed his toy car into a police car. He put stickers on it and made it look like the one he saw. Tim was very happy with his new toy police car.

One day, a boy named Tim had to take an exam. He felt scared. He wanted to do well on the exam because it was useful for his school. Tim's mom told him not to worry. "You will do great," she said.
On the day of the exam, it rained a lot. Tim had to walk to school. He did not have a coat, so he got very wet. His clothes were soaked. When Tim got to school, he was cold and wet. He felt sad.
Then, something unexpected happened. The teacher saw Tim and said, "Oh no, you are soaked! We will not have the exam today. We will have it next week instead." Tim felt happy. He had more time to study and get ready for the exam.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved the color pink and always wore pink dresses. One day, her mommy made her a tasty cake with pink frosting. Lily ate the whole cake and asked for more.
But then, Lily started feeling sick. Her tummy hurt and she wanted to quit eating. Her mommy told her to rest and drink some water. 
Sadly, Lily's tummy ache got worse and she had to go to the hospital. The doctor said she ate too much cake and got very sick. Lily learned that sometimes it's important to quit eating, even if it's something tasty and pink.

Once upon a time, there was a big lion. He lived in the jungle with his friends. One day, the lion was very hungry. He wanted to eat something yummy. He went to his friend, the zebra, and said, "Zebra, I am very hungry. Can you give me some dough to eat?"
The zebra said, "I don't have any dough, but I can give you some grass to eat." The lion didn't want to eat grass. He wanted something else. He started to roar loudly.
Suddenly, a monkey appeared. He was very lively and happy. He said, "Lion, why are you roaring so loudly?" The lion said, "I am hungry and I want to eat something yummy. Do you have any dough?"
The monkey said, "I don't have any dough, but I can give you some bananas to eat." The lion was happy and thanked the monkey. He ate the bananas and felt full. From that day on, the lion learned that sometimes, he had to try new things to find something yummy to eat.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the store with her mom. One day, they went to the store to buy some food. Lily saw a toy cart and asked her mom if she could have it. Her mom said, "No, we don't need it." 
Lily felt sad because she really liked the cart. She thought about it and decided to show her mom how much she valued the cart. She took her mom to the toy section and pointed to the cart. She said, "Mom, this cart is very special to me. It is light and I can carry it easily. Please can I have it?" 
Her mom saw how much Lily valued the cart and decided to buy it for her. Lily was very happy and pushed her new cart around the store. From that day on, she always took her cart with her when she went to the store.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a big map. The map has many colors and shapes. Anna and Ben want to see what the map shows.
They look at the map. They see a blue shape. The blue shape is water. They see a green shape. The green shape is land. They see a yellow shape. The yellow shape is sand. They see a red shape. The red shape is fire.
Anna and Ben are curious. They want to go to the land. They think the land has trees and flowers and animals. They ask their mom and dad if they can go to the land. Their mom and dad say yes, but they have to be careful.
They take the map and go to the bus. The bus takes them to the land. They get off the bus and walk to the green shape. They see a fence. The fence has a sign. The sign says "Do not enter". Anna and Ben do not read the sign. They climb over the fence.
They see a big tree. The tree has fruits. The fruits are green and round. Anna and Ben are hungry. They pick some fruits and bite them. The fruits are sour. Anna and Ben make a face. They spit out the fruits. They do not like the sour fruits.
They hear a noise. They turn around. They see a big animal. The animal has horns and fur and a long tongue. The animal is angry. The animal sees the fruits on the ground. The animal thinks Anna and Ben stole the fruits. The animal chases Anna and Ben.
Anna and Ben are scared. They run back to the fence. They climb over the fence. They drop the map. They run to the bus. The bus takes them back to the park. They hug their mom and dad. They are glad to be safe.
They learn a lesson. They learn to not go to places they do not know. They learn to not take things that are not theirs. They learn to not eat things that are sour. They learn to listen to their mom and dad. They learn to be happy with what they have.

Once upon a time, there was a small flea. The flea lived on a big dog. The dog was very kind. The flea wanted to improve and be a good friend to the dog.
One day, the dog went to a beautiful park. The dog played with other dogs. The flea saw a chance to help. The flea jumped from dog to dog. The flea told the other dogs how to be better friends.
But, the other dogs did not like the flea. They felt itchy. The dogs ran away from the flea. The flea was sad. The kind dog came back to the flea. The dog told the flea, "You can improve by staying with me."
The flea learned that it is good to help, but not to make others feel bad. The flea stayed with the kind dog and they were happy together.

Tom likes to read books with his mom. They sit on the sofa and look at the pictures and words on the pages. Mom reads the words and Tom listens. Sometimes he asks questions or says what he sees.
One day, they read a book about animals. Tom likes animals. He sees a cat, a dog, a bird, and a fish. He points to each one and says their names. Mom nods and smiles. She asks him, "Which animal do you like best?"
Tom thinks for a moment. He likes all the animals, but he has a favorite. He points to the dog and says, "I like the dog best. He is cute and furry. He can run and play. He can bark and wag his tail. He is a good friend."
Mom replies, "You are right, Tom. The dog is a good friend. He is also a good animal. Do you know what he likes to eat?"
Tom nods. He knows what the dog likes to eat. He says, "He likes to eat bones and meat and kibble. He also likes to drink water and milk. Sometimes he likes to eat cookies, but only if we share."
Mom laughs and hugs Tom. She says, "You are very smart, Tom. You know a lot about the dog. I'm proud of you. Do you want to read another page?"
Tom nods again. He likes to read books with his mom. He says, "Yes, please. I want to see more animals. Maybe we can see a lion or a monkey or a bear. They are also good animals, but they live far away."
Mom turns the page and they see more animals. They read and talk and have fun. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big, wild lion. The lion was very tired and needed to take a nap. He found a comfy spot under a tree and closed his eyes. While he was napping, a little mouse came along. The mouse saw a thread hanging from the lion's mane and decided to play with it. The lion didn't wake up, so the mouse kept playing with the thread until it was all tangled up. When the lion woke up, he saw the mouse and the tangled thread. He was very angry at first, but then he realized that the mouse was just playing and didn't mean any harm. They became friends and played together every day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a tough jeep. The jeep was big and strong, but it had a problem. It was broken! The wheels didn't turn and the engine didn't work.
A boy saw the jeep and wanted to help. He knew how to fix things. He looked at the jeep and saw what was wrong. He got his tools and started to fix the jeep.
He worked hard and after a while, the jeep was fixed! The wheels turned and the engine started. The boy was happy and so was the jeep. They drove around together and had lots of fun. The end.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing with his toy car. He was restless and wanted to find a new place to play. Tim saw a big drain near his house. He thought it would be fun to race his toy car down the drain.
As Tim tried to put his toy car in the drain, it fell in. He was sad and tried to reach the car, but his arm was too short. He didn't know what to do. Just then, his friend Lily came by and saw Tim looking sad.
"What's wrong, Tim?" asked Lily. Tim told her about his toy car in the drain. Lily had a long stick and thought it might help. She put the stick in the drain and told Tim, "Try to reach your car with this!"
Tim used the stick to reach his car and got it out of the drain. He was so happy and thanked Lily for her help. They played with their toy cars together and had lots of fun. Tim learned that sometimes, all you need is a friend to help you when you're in trouble.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby reindeer named Rudolph. He lived in a big forest with his friends. One day, Rudolph and his friends were playing hide and seek. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. It was a hunter! The hunter wanted to lift Rudolph and take him away.
Rudolph's friend, a little rabbit, said, "Don't worry, I'll save you!" The rabbit ran to the hunter and said, "Please don't take Rudolph away, he's our friend."
The hunter replied, "I'm sorry, but I need a reindeer for my Christmas dinner."
The rabbit had an idea. He said, "Why don't you take me instead? I'm much smaller and won't be as tasty."
The hunter thought this was a good idea and took the rabbit instead of Rudolph. Rudolph and his friends were happy that they were safe, but sad that their friend was gone. They learned that sometimes unexpected things happen, but they can still be brave and help each other.

Once upon a time, there was a big red barn on a farm. The barn was old and needed some help. A kind man came to restore the barn. He wanted to make it new and strong again.
One day, the man found an adorable little cat in the barn. The cat was small and cute. The man said, "Hello, little cat! Do you live in this barn?" The cat meowed and rubbed against the man's leg.
Together, the man and the adorable cat worked to fix the barn. They painted it red and made it look new again. When they were done, the cat had a safe and happy home. The man and the cat became good friends, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to a big building. She went up and down in the lift and then arrived at the floor where her mommy worked. Lily felt nervous because she had never been there before. But when she saw her mommy's smile, she felt happy. They played games and sang songs together. Then it was time to go home. Lily said goodbye to her mommy and went back in the lift. She arrived at the ground floor and saw her daddy waiting for her. They went home and had dinner together. Lily felt tired but happy because she had a fun day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She wanted to go to the farm and see the animals. When she got there, she saw a big black pig. The pig was very big and very loud. Lily wanted to touch the pig, but she was scared. So, she asked her mommy to hold her hand. They walked closer to the pig and Lily touched its nose. The pig was very friendly and oinked happily. Lily was happy too!

Once upon a time, there was a spoiled ostrich named Ollie. Ollie always got what he wanted and never shared with his friends. One day, Ollie saw a group of bunnies playing and asked if he could join. The bunnies said yes, but Ollie didn't want to play their games. He wanted to play his own game and made the bunnies hop around him while he stood still.
The bunnies didn't like this game, but Ollie didn't care. He just wanted to be the center of attention. Suddenly, Ollie got scared and ran away, causing the bunnies to fall and hurt themselves. Ollie didn't care about the bunnies' pain and kept running until he got lost.
Ollie realized he was alone and scared. He wished he had been a nicer friend to the bunnies. But it was too late. Ollie never found his way back and was never seen again. The moral of the story is to be kind to others and not be selfish like Ollie.

Once upon a time, there was a big, impressive structure. It was a house made of toys. In this house lived a kind rabbit named Remy and a helpful squirrel named Sally.
One day, Remy saw that his favorite toy was missing. He asked Sally, "Did you borrow my toy?" Sally said, "Yes, I did. I'm sorry, I wanted to play with it too." Remy was sad and a little mad.
Remy and Sally talked and decided to share the toy. They played together and had a lot of fun. They learned that sharing is better than taking things without asking.
The moral of the story is to always ask before you borrow something and to share with your friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to fly his kite in the park. His kite was big and colorful, with a sweet picture on it. One day, Timmy was flying his kite when a little girl came up to him.
"Can I sit with you?" the little girl asked.
"Sure!" Timmy said, happy to have someone to share his kite with.
The two children sat on the grass and watched the kite fly high in the sky. They talked and laughed, and Timmy shared his sweet snacks with the little girl. It was a happy day for both of them. When it was time to go home, they said goodbye and promised to play together again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little goat. The goat loved to run and play. One day, the goat saw a big tree. The goat wanted to climb the tree. So, the goat tried to climb, but it was hard.
A bird saw the goat and said, "Stop, goat! You can't climb the tree. You will fall!" The goat looked at the bird and said, "I want to try. I won't fall."
The goat tried again and again. But the goat could not climb the tree. The goat was sad. Then, the bird had an idea. "I know! Let's play a game. We can run and jump, but not climb the tree."
The goat liked the idea. So, the goat and the bird played together. They ran and jumped, but they did not climb the tree. The goat was happy and not sad anymore. And they played until the sun went down, and the sky was dark.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved animals and wanted to go on a safari. He asked his mom if they could go, but she said no. Timmy insisted and asked again and again. Finally, his mom said yes.
On the safari, Timmy saw lots of animals like lions, zebras, and giraffes. Some of them were smelly, but Timmy didn't mind. He was having too much fun.
After the safari, Timmy was tired but happy. He thanked his mom for taking him and insisted that they go again soon. His mom smiled and said they would. Timmy went to bed dreaming of all the animals he saw on his safari adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to bake with her mommy. One day, they decided to make cupcakes. Lily's mommy got out the mixer, which made a loud noise. Lily thought it was funny.
As they mixed the batter, Lily noticed something unusual. There was a strange smell coming from the oven. Her mommy said not to worry and put the cupcakes in to bake. 
When the cupcakes were done, they took them out of the oven. Lily's mommy took a bite and made a funny face. Lily asked what was wrong. Her mommy said the cupcakes tasted unusual. Lily tried one and agreed. Then they realized they had accidentally put salt instead of sugar in the batter! They laughed and decided to try again another day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big, fluffy cat named Mittens. Mittens was very tidy and always cleaned his fur. One day, Lily wanted to draw a picture with ink. She got some ink and started to draw on the paper. Suddenly, she accidentally spilled ink on the floor. It scared her because she thought her mommy would be mad. But then Mittens came and licked up all the ink. Lily was happy that Mittens helped her and she gave him a big hug.

One day, a boy named Tim found a big drum in his room. He was very happy. He liked to play the drum and make loud sounds. Tim played the drum all day and all night. He made his mom and dad very dizzy with the loud sounds. But Tim did not want to stop playing the drum.
Tim's friend, Sam, came to play with him. Sam wanted to help Tim play the drum. They played the drum together and made even louder sounds. They played so loud that the dog ran away, and the cat hid under the bed. Tim and Sam did not care. They just wanted to play the drum.
Soon, it was time for Sam to go home. Tim's mom and dad were still dizzy from the loud drum sounds. They were very sad and tired. They told Tim that he could not play the drum anymore. Tim was sad too, but he did not know how to make his mom and dad feel better. The drum was gone, and everyone was unhappy.

Once upon a time, there was a big tree in the forest. The tree was very tall and had many branches. The animals in the forest loved to play and rest under the tree's shade. One day, a big wind came and the tree began to shake. Suddenly, the tree began to tear and it fell down with a loud sound. The animals were sad because they lost their shade.
The next day, the animals decided to use the lumber from the fallen tree to build a new shade. They worked hard and built a big house with many windows. They were very proud of their work and invited all the animals in the forest to come and rest in their new shade. From that day on, the animals were happy again and played and rested under their new shade.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and build things with his blocks. One day, he saw his dad using a saw to cut some wood. Timmy was amazed by how the saw worked.
"Daddy, what are you doing?" Timmy asked.
"I'm making a plan to build a birdhouse for our backyard," his dad replied.
Timmy wanted to help his dad with the birdhouse, so he asked if he could use the saw too. His dad was a little nervous, but he showed Timmy how to use it safely. Timmy was so proud of himself for using the saw and helping his dad.
Later that day, Timmy's mom came home and saw the birdhouse. She was so proud of Timmy and his dad. "Wow, you guys did a great job! I'm so impressed," she said.
Timmy felt happy and proud, but he also felt a little ashamed. He had accidentally cut one of the pieces of wood too short. But his dad told him it was okay and that they could fix it together. Timmy learned that making mistakes is okay, as long as you have a plan to fix them.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sue. Sue was very lucky. She had a lot of friends. One day, Sue found a note. The note said that she was going to marry a prince. Sue was very happy.
Sue told her friends about the note. They were all very excited. But then, a mean girl named Lily said she wanted to marry the prince too. Sue was sad. She did not want to fight with Lily.
One day, the prince came to town. Both Sue and Lily wanted to marry him. The prince said he would marry the girl who was the most kind. Sue was very kind to her friends. Lily was not kind. In the end, the prince chose to marry Sue. Sue was very lucky and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big forest where many animals lived. One day, a little zebra named Ziggy wanted to join a group of cool giraffes. But the giraffes thought Ziggy looked weird with all his stripes.
Feeling sad, Ziggy wandered around the forest and met a wise owl who told him that being different is what makes him special. Ziggy felt better and decided to be himself.
The next day, the giraffes were in trouble. They were stuck in a mud pit and couldn't get out. Ziggy saw them and remembered how they treated him before. But he decided to help them anyway.
Using his strong legs, Ziggy pulled the giraffes out of the mud. The giraffes were grateful and realized that Ziggy was a true friend. From that day on, they all played together and never judged each other again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy boat in the bathtub. He would make it sail around and pretend it was on a big adventure.
One day, Timmy's mom gave him a new object to play with. It was a shiny, red ball. Timmy was very excited and played with it all day. But that night, when he went to bed, he felt troubled. He couldn't find his toy boat anywhere.
The next morning, Timmy went back to the bathtub to look for his toy boat. But instead, he saw something amazing. His toy boat was sailing in the bathtub with his shiny, red ball on board! Timmy realized that the ball had accidentally fallen into the bathtub and had helped his toy boat sail all night long. From that day on, Timmy always made sure to keep his toy boat and his shiny, red ball together.

Lily liked to play with her toys in her room. She had a big lamp that made her room bright and warm. She also had a small lamp that she could turn on and off by herself. She liked to pretend that the small lamp was her friend and talk to it.
One day, Lily's mom came into her room and saw the small lamp on the floor. She picked it up and said, "Lily, this lamp does not belong here. It belongs on the table. If you leave it on the floor, someone might step on it and break it. Then you will have no lamp to play with."
Lily felt sad and scared. She did not want to lose her lamp friend. She said, "But mom, I love my lamp. It is my friend. It likes to be with me. Please let me keep it on the floor."
Lily's mom shook her head and said, "No, Lily, you have to put it on the table. It is not safe on the floor. And lamps are not friends. They are things. You have real friends to play with, like your teddy bear and your doll."
Lily did not like what her mom said. She thought her mom was wrong and mean. She said, "No, mom, you are wrong and mean. My lamp is my friend. It is not a thing. It is alive. It talks to me. It tells me stories. It makes me happy. You are sour. You do not understand."
Lily's mom sighed and said, "Lily, I am not sour. I am trying to help you. Lamps do not talk. They do not tell stories. They do not make you happy. They just give light. You are making things up. You need to be more realistic. Now, put the lamp on the table and stop arguing."
Lily did not want to put the lamp on the table. She wanted to keep it on the floor. She wanted to keep playing with it. She wanted to keep talking to it. She wanted to keep being happy. She did not want to be realistic. She wanted to be imaginative. She said, "No, mom, I will not put the lamp on the table. I will keep it on the floor. I will keep playing with it. I will keep talking to it. I will keep being happy. I do not want to be realistic. I want to be imaginative. You can not make me do what you want. You can not take away my lamp friend. You can not take away my fun."
Lily's mom was angry and tired. She said, "Lily, that is enough. You are being stubborn and rude. You are not listening to me. You are not obeying me. You are not being a good girl. You are making me sad and mad. You need to learn to respect me and follow the rules. Now, put the lamp on the table or I will take it away from you and you will have no lamp at all."
Lily was angry and scared. She said, "No, mom, you are being stubborn and rude. You are not listening to me. You are not understanding me. You are not being a good mom. You are making me sad and mad. You need to learn to respect me and let me be me. Now, leave me alone or I will scream and cry and make a big fuss."
Lily and her mom stared at each other. They both held the lamp. They both pulled the lamp. They both wanted the lamp. They both did not want to give up. They both did not want to say sorry. They both did not want to hug. They both did not want to be happy. They both were unhappy.

Once upon a time, there was a clever dog named Max. Max loved to snap his paws to make sounds. One day, Max went to a big place called the university. He wanted to learn more things.
At the university, Max met a big, friendly bear named Ben. Ben also wanted to learn new things. They became good friends. They played together and learned together.
One day, Max and Ben found a magic book. They opened the book and snap! Suddenly, Max became a big bear and Ben became a small dog. They laughed and played together in their new forms. They knew they would always have fun and learn new things at the university.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to draw and color on paper. One day, she was drawing a picture for her mommy when she realized she only had one piece of paper left. But she also remembered that her daddy had some important papers on his desk.
Lily thought it would be okay to take one of her daddy's papers to finish her drawing. But when her daddy found out, he got upset because the paper was very important. He told Lily she needed to hurry and find a way to make things right.
Lily felt sad for taking the paper, but she knew she needed to fix her mistake. She quickly ran to her room and found some old paper she could use instead. She finished her drawing and gave it to her mommy, who loved it. From that day on, Lily knew it was always better to ask for permission instead of taking something that wasn't hers.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and go on adventures. One day, she saw her mommy and daddy getting ready for a party. 
"Mommy, what are you doing?" asked Lily.
"We're getting ready to celebrate Auntie's birthday," replied her mommy.
Lily was excited and asked if she could help. Her mommy gave her a bottle of juice to bring to the party. "Be careful, it's smooth," said her mommy.
Lily held the bottle tightly and walked to the party. When she got there, she saw everyone having fun and eating cake. She gave the bottle to her Auntie and said, "Happy birthday!"
Auntie was happy and thanked Lily. "You're such a kind little girl," said Auntie. "Always remember to share and be kind to others."
Lily smiled and learned an important lesson. From that day on, she always shared her toys and was kind to others.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy village. The people who lived there were always yawning and rubbing their eyes. One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk in the village. She stumbled on a rock and fell down. Her knees hurt, but she got up and kept walking. She saw a big tree and sat down to rest. She saw some birds flying and smiled. After a while, she went back home and took a nap.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who was going on a trip with her family. She was very excited to pack her luggage with her favorite toys and clothes. Her mommy helped her to pack everything carefully.
When they arrived at the airport, Lily saw a big dog who was marking his territory. She asked her mommy, "What is the dog doing?" Her mommy explained, "The dog is leaving his mark so other dogs know this is his spot."
While they were waiting for their flight, Lily accidentally bumped into a chair and hurt her knee. Her daddy gave her a band-aid to make it feel better. Lily said, "Thank you, Daddy. Now I can walk and carry my luggage to the plane." They all boarded the plane and had a fun adventure together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her pretty drum. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her drum. She started to play a song and sing along. Suddenly, a boy came up to her and asked if he could play with her drum. 
Lily didn't want to share her drum because she was afraid the boy would break it. But then, the boy offered her a toy car in exchange for playing with the drum. Lily thought the car was pretty and decided to let the boy play with her drum. 
As the boy played, Lily realized that he was really good at playing the drum. She was surprised and happy that she had shared her drum with him. When they finished playing, the boy thanked Lily and gave her the toy car. Lily was very happy and they became friends. From that day on, they played together in the park every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom liked to sell his toys to his friends. One day, he found a harmless light in his room. The light was small and pretty. It changed colors and made Tom smile.
Tom wanted to show the light to his friend, Sue. He went to Sue's house and said, "Look, Sue! I have a pretty light. Do you want to buy it?" Sue looked at the light and said, "Yes, I like it! How much does it cost?"
Tom thought for a moment and said, "Five cookies!" Sue agreed and gave Tom five cookies. Tom was happy to sell the harmless light to Sue. They played with the light together and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mommy. They brought a flag to put on the ground so they could have a picnic. While they were eating sandwiches, Lily saw a butterfly and wanted to catch it. She ran after it, but it flew away and she got lost.
Lily's mommy looked for her everywhere, but couldn't find her. Lily was scared and started to cry. Suddenly, a little boy appeared and said, "Don't worry, I will help you find your mommy." He was very gifted at finding things and knew just where to look. They found Lily's mommy and Lily was very happy.
After they found her mommy, the little boy said, "Let's play hide and seek!" They played and had lots of fun. Lily was very happy that she made a new friend and found her mommy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to travel with her family. One day, they went to a big mountain. Mia was very excited.
Mia's dad had a stubborn donkey. The donkey carried a bag with stamps. Mia said, "Donkey, let's go up the mountain!" But the donkey did not want to go. Mia's dad said, "You must be nice to the donkey."
So Mia gave the donkey a big hug. The donkey felt happy and started to walk up the mountain. Mia and her family followed the donkey. They saw many pretty things on their way.
When they reached the top, Mia's dad took out the stamps. He put a stamp on Mia's hand. It was a star! Mia was so happy. They all went back down the mountain, and the donkey was not stubborn anymore. They had a great day.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a messy room. The owner of the house was a kind lady. She had a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play in the messy room. He would jump and run all day.
One day, the kind lady told Spot to clean the messy room. Spot did not know how to clean. So, the kind lady showed him. She said, "Pick up the toys, and put them away." Spot would repeat what she said, "Pick up toys, put away." He tried his best to clean the room.
After a while, the messy room was clean. The owner was happy, and Spot was happy too. They both danced and laughed together. From that day on, Spot would always help the kind lady clean the messy room. They lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted fish named Finn. Finn lived in a big pond with his fish friends. One day, they saw a faucet near the pond. They did not know what it was, but they wanted to find out.
Finn said to his friends, "I will dive and look at the faucet." His friends said, "Be careful, Finn!" Finn dove down and saw that the faucet was shiny and new. He touched it with his fin and suddenly, water came out!
The water made the pond bigger and bigger. Finn's friends were scared, but Finn said, "Don't worry! This is fun!" They all played in the new water and had a great time. The faucet made their pond even better than before.

Once upon a time there was an old man who lived in a big house. Everywhere the old man looked, he saw things that were very old. One day the old man was poking around in the closet and he found something very ancient. It was a magical box! Inside it was a very special item. 
The old man wanted to lend the special item to his friend, so he asked his friend if she would like to borrow it. She said yes and so the old man took the ancient box from the closet and gave it to his friend. She opened the box and was so excited because inside was a shiny new toy! 
The old man felt so happy that he had been able to lend his special item to his friend. And they continued to share it together for many years.

Once upon a time, there was a big black cat named Tom. Tom lived in a small house with a nice girl named Sue. Sue and Tom loved to play all day. Sue would rub Tom's back, and Tom would purr. They were very happy together.
One sunny day, Tom was outside playing in the yard. He saw a big ball and ran to it. Tom tried to rub on the ball, but it felt uncomfortable. It was not soft like Sue's hands. Tom was confused, but he kept rubbing the ball.
Suddenly, the ball popped! Out came a small, scared mouse. The mouse looked at Tom and said, "Thank you for saving me!" Tom was very surprised. He never knew a mouse could talk! From that day on, Tom and the mouse became friends, and they all played together happily.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big, open room with many toys. In the corner of the room, there was a big box. Tim loved the box very much.
One day, Tim's friend, Sue, came to play. Sue saw the big box in the corner and wanted to play with it too. Tim didn't want to share his box. He said, "No, it's mine!" Sue was sad, but she still wanted to play with the box.
Sue thought for a moment and then said, "Please, can we play with the box together?" Tim looked at Sue and thought about it. He didn't want his friend to be sad. So, Tim said, "Okay, we can play with the box together." They both played with the box and had lots of fun. From that day on, Tim and Sue always shared their toys and played together.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Benny. Benny loved to play games with his friends. One day, Benny wanted to plan a special game for his friends to play. He thought and thought about what game to play. Finally, he had a plan! 
Benny's game was a race to see who could hop the fastest. All of his friends were very competitive and wanted to win. Benny was excited to see who would win the race. 
After the race, Benny's mom brought out some grape juice for the bunnies to drink. Benny thought it tasted like wine because it was so yummy. They all drank their juice and talked about how much fun they had playing the game. Benny was happy that his plan worked out and everyone had a great time. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved flowers and her favorite flower was a rose. One day, Lily decided to go to the garden to get a rose. She walked quietly so she wouldn't wake up the birds. When she got to the garden, she saw a big red rose. She picked the rose and smelled it. It smelled so good! Lily was very happy to get her favorite flower. She went back home with the rose and showed it to her mommy. Her mommy was happy too and put the rose in a vase on the table. From that day on, Lily always went to the garden to get a rose.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to race his toy cars around the house. He had a red car, a blue car, and a green car. Timmy's mom always told him to keep his toys tidy, but he never listened.
One day, Timmy was racing his cars when he accidentally knocked over a vase. It fell to the ground and broke into a million pieces. Timmy was very sad and scared because he knew his mom would be upset. He tried to clean up the mess as best he could, but there were still marks on the floor.
Just then, Timmy's mom came home and saw the mess. She was upset at first, but then she saw how hard Timmy had tried to clean up. She gave him a big hug and told him that accidents happen. Together, they cleaned up the rest of the mess and made sure everything was tidy again. From that day on, Timmy always made sure to race his cars in a safe spot where nothing could get broken.

Once upon a time, there was a princess. She was very pretty and kind. One day, she met a frog. The frog said, "Hello, princess! Do you want to play a game with me?"
The princess said, "Yes, I love games! What game do you want to play?"
The frog said, "Let's spin around and see who can spin the most times!"
The princess agreed, and they started to spin. The frog spun very fast, but the princess was mighty and spun even faster! They had so much fun spinning together. 
After they finished, the frog said, "You are the best spinner, princess! Thank you for playing with me."
The princess smiled and said, "Thank you for playing with me too, frog. Let's play again soon!" And they became good friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to play outside with her friends. But one day, she saw something disgusting on the ground. It was a big, brown and smelly pile. "Ew!" she said to her friends. "What is that?" Her friends didn't know.
Mia's mom came outside and saw the disgusting pile too. "Oh, Mia," she said, "that is from the old tree. In this season, the tree loses its leaves and makes a mess." Mia didn't like the mess, but she remembered that each season has its own beauty.
One day, Mia saw a tiny green plant growing in the disgusting pile. She was surprised! She asked her mom, "How can something so pretty come from something so yucky?" Her mom smiled and said, "Sometimes, good things can come from bad things. We just have to be patient and remember to look for the good."
Mia and her friends learned a lesson that day - even when things look bad, there might be something good waiting to happen. They played outside every season, always looking for the good in each one. And they never forgot the tiny green plant that grew from the disgusting pile.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to read amazing books. One day, he found a book with a talking page. The page could walk and talk! Tim was very happy to have a new friend.
"Hello, I am Page," said the page. "Do you want to play with me?" Tim said, "Yes, let's play!" They played all day in the sun. They ran and jumped and laughed together.
After playing, Tim and Page went home. Tim said, "Page, I want to show you my room." Page said, "I will follow you." They went to Tim's room and looked at all his toys. They had so much fun together. Tim and Page were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and explore the world around him. One day, he was walking in the forest when he saw a big, fierce lion. 
Timmy thought to himself, "Oh no, what should I do?" Suddenly, he felt an itch on his arm and started scratching it. The lion saw Timmy and started walking towards him. 
Timmy said, "Hello Mr. Lion, my name is Timmy. Do you want to be friends?" The lion stopped and thought for a moment. Then he said, "Yes, I would like that very much." 
From that day on, Timmy and the lion were the best of friends. They played together every day and went on many adventures. Timmy learned that sometimes, even the fiercest animals can be kind and friendly.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who had a loyal dog named Max. They loved to play together with a string. One day, Lily went to the park with Max and her string. They were having fun until a big dog came and took the string from Lily. 
Lily said, "Hey, that's my string! Give it back!" But the big dog just growled and ran away with the string. Max barked and chased after the big dog, but he was too fast. Lily felt sad because she didn't have her string anymore. 
But then, Max came back with the string in his mouth! He had chased the big dog and brought the string back to Lily. Lily was so happy and said, "Max, you're the best dog ever! You always have my back." From that day on, Lily and Max played with the string together, and they were always loyal friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play on the slide in her backyard. One day, her mom brought home some paint and a brush. Lily was excited to paint her slide. She used all the colors of the rainbow to make it look pretty.
But then, Lily's friend Timmy came over and saw the slide. He said it looked old-fashioned and not cool. Lily felt sad and didn't understand why her slide wasn't good enough. Her mom explained to her that just because something isn't modern or new, it doesn't mean it's not special. 
Lily realized that her slide was still fun to play on, even if it wasn't modern. She learned that it's important to appreciate what you have and not always want something new. From that day on, Lily was happy with her slide and enjoyed playing on it every day.

Once upon a time, in a lovely little house, there lived a dog named Spike. Spike was a happy dog who loved to play with his ball. Every day, he would run around the yard and have lots of fun.
One day, while playing with his ball, Spike saw a little bird. The bird was sad because it could not find its mommy. Spike wanted to help the little bird. So, he asked the bird, "Do you know where your mommy is?"
The little bird said, "No, I don't know. Can you help me find her?" Spike nodded and they went on a search together. They looked in the trees and under the bushes. Finally, they found the little bird's mommy.
The mommy bird was so happy to see her baby. She thanked Spike for his help. From that day on, Spike and the little bird became the best of friends. They played together every day in the lovely yard, and they were always very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big sister named Emily. One day, Lily asked Emily, "Why do I have two eyes?" Emily said, "You have two eyes so you can see better." 
Lily replied, "Oh, I see now! Thank you for explaining it to me." Emily smiled and said, "You're welcome, little sister." 
Later that day, Lily and Emily went to the park. They saw a boy with a very modest kite. Lily said, "Wow, that kite is so small!" Emily explained, "It's a modest kite, but it can still fly high." 
The boy overheard them and said, "Yes, my kite may be small, but it's still special to me." Lily and Emily smiled and said, "We think it's special too!"

Once there was a pilot who seemed very friendly. He always smiled and said hello. He seemed harmless like a teddy bear. One day he took off in his plane and disappeared in the sky. Everyone looked up in the sky with amazement. They couldn't believe it! 
The pilot flew back in a few minutes and landed the plane. Everyone was so happy to see him again. They all waved to him. He seemed so pleased with himself. From that day on, the pilot was very popular in the town. He was known as the harmless pilot who made everyone smile.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Timmy's mom took him to the park in the east. They played on the slide and swings. Timmy loved the slide because it was smooth and made him feel like he was flying.
But then, Timmy had to go potty. He went to the bathroom all by himself, but when he came out, he realized his pants were wet. He felt embarrassed and didn't want anyone to see him. But his mom hugged him and said it was okay, accidents happen sometimes.
After that, Timmy went back to playing on the slide and forgot all about his accident. He had so much fun with his mom and felt happy again. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant. He was very kind and loved to play with his friends. One day, he got lost in the forest and couldn't find his way back home. He was very scared and didn't know what to do.
Then, a little boy came along and saw the elephant. He wanted to help him, but he didn't know how. He tried to ask the elephant where his home was, but the elephant couldn't answer. The little boy felt stupid and didn't know how to solve the problem.
Sadly, the elephant never found his way back home and had to live in the forest forever. The little boy felt very sad and wished he could have done something to help the elephant.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she went for a walk in the park and saw a big pile of leaves. She jumped in them and laughed with joy.
But then, a strong wind blew and all the leaves flew away. Lily got sad because there were no more leaves to play with. Suddenly, she saw a good idea. She ran to a nearby tree and grabbed a big leaf. She held it up high and the wind stopped. The leaf stayed still and Lily was happy again. 
As she walked home, something unexpected happened. A little squirrel appeared and took the leaf from Lily's hand. Lily was surprised but then she saw the squirrel's nest. The squirrel used the leaf to make a cozy bed for its babies. Lily smiled and felt happy that the leaf could be used for something good.

One day, a big bird and a small bird were talking. The big bird said, "I have news! I can change into a healthy bird if I eat good food." The small bird was very surprised and wanted to be a healthy bird too.
The big bird and the small bird started to eat good food. They ate fruits, vegetables, and seeds. They played together and had fun. They both became healthy and strong. Their friends saw them and wanted to be healthy too.
One day, the big bird and the small bird found a big box. They opened the box and found a lot of candy inside. The big bird and the small bird looked at each other and said, "We should not eat this candy. It is not healthy." They closed the box and continued to eat good food. The other birds saw this and learned that being healthy is more important than eating candy. They all lived happily and healthy ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Max. Max was very hairy, with lots of fur all over his body. One day, Max went outside to play with his ball. He threw the ball up in the air and it went flying! But when Max tried to catch it, he missed and the ball went over the fence. 
Max was sad because he couldn't play with his ball anymore. But then his owner came outside and saw what happened. She went to get a ladder and climbed over the fence to get the ball. When she came back, Max was so happy! He wagged his tail and licked her face to say thank you. 
The result of the owner's kindness was that Max got to play with his ball again. He was so happy that he didn't even notice how hairy he was!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, Timmy's dad brought him a new model car. Timmy was so happy and he played with it all day long.
Timmy wanted to keep his new car safe, so he put it in a special box. The box was very pretty and had a picture of a race car on it. Timmy felt rich because he had such a special toy.
Every day, Timmy would take out his model car and play with it. He loved the way it looked and how it moved. Timmy promised to always keep it safe and never let anything happen to it.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play outside. One day, Spot saw a big hole in the fence. He thought, "I can escape!" So, he went through the hole and ran away.
Spot ran and ran until he met a big cat. The cat looked at Spot and said, "You look guilty. Did you escape from your home?" Spot nodded his head and said, "Yes, I did. I wanted to explore and have fun."
The cat said, "It's not good to escape from home. You should go back before your family gets worried." Spot thought about it and agreed. So, he went back through the hole in the fence and back to his home. His family was happy to see him, and Spot promised not to escape again.

Once upon a time, there was a healthy cat named Tom. Tom liked to play in the sun. One day, he went for a walk and saw a hedge. The hedge was green and pretty.
Behind the hedge, Tom found a little bird. The bird was sad. Tom wanted to help the bird, so he asked, "Why are you sad, little bird?"
The bird said, "I lost my mom. Can you tell me where she is?" Tom thought for a moment and said, "I will help you find your mom."
Tom and the bird looked for the mom. They walked and walked until they saw a big tree. In the tree, they found the bird's mom. The bird was happy to see her mom, and they both thanked Tom for his help. From that day on, Tom and the birds were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the library with her mommy. One day, Lily and her mommy went to the library, but Lily accidentally dropped her ice cream on the floor. It made a big mess and the floor became dirty.
Lily's mommy was upset and told her that she should have been more careful. Lily felt sad and apologized. Suddenly, a boy came over and said, "I can help!" He took out a bow from his bag and started cleaning the floor. Lily and her mommy were surprised and happy.
After the boy finished cleaning the floor, Lily's mommy thanked him and asked why he had a bow in his bag. The boy replied, "I always carry a bow with me, because I like to help people." Lily learned that it's important to always be kind and helpful, even when things go wrong.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to listen to music with her mommy. One day, they went to the store and saw a mannequin wearing an unusual dress. Lily asked her mommy what it was and her mommy said it was called fashion.
Lily wanted to wear a fashion dress too, but her mommy said they were too expensive. So, Lily decided to make her own fashion dress. She listened carefully to her mommy's instructions on how to sew and picked out her favorite fabrics.
After a few hours, Lily had made a beautiful and unusual dress. She wore it proudly and showed it to her mommy. Her mommy was amazed and told her how talented she was. From that day on, Lily loved to listen to her mommy's advice and make her own fashion creations.

Mommy took Little Johnny's hand in hers and led him over to the old man's house. "Let's go say hi," she said softly. Little Johnny was shy, but he nodded his head and kept walking. 
When they arrived, the old man welcomed them into his home with a big smile. He showed Little Johnny around, showing him all of the interesting objects and curiosities in his house. Little Johnny was intrigued, especially when he saw the old man's zipper. 
The old man explained to Little Johnny that the zipper was very special and it held all of his secret treasures. Little Johnny wanted to borrow the zipper for a little while, so he could see what was inside it. The old man agreed and kindly gave Little Johnny the zipper. 
Little Johnny eagerly opened the zipper and gasped with amazement at all the treasures he found inside. It was exactly as the old man described, filled with all kinds of wonderful trinkets and curious objects. Little Johnny was ecstatic. 
The old man gave Little Johnny a knowing smile and said, "I bet you will have lots of fun with my zipper." Little Johnny thanked him and said, "Yes, I will! And someday I'll bring it back." The old man smiled.

Once upon a time, there was a fair princess who lived in a big castle. She loved to gather flowers in the garden with her friends. One day, while they were playing, they saw a mole digging a hole. The mole was very small and furry. The princess and her friends were curious about the mole, so they gathered around to watch it. The mole was shy and quickly ran away. The princess and her friends went back to gathering flowers and having fun. The end.

Once upon a time, a quiet mule named Max lived on a farm. Max was very good at carrying things. One day, a girl named Lily came to the farm. Lily wanted to find a pet to play with.
Lily asked Max, "Do you know a good pet for me?" Max thought for a moment and then said, "I recommend a cat. Cats are fun and easy to take care of." Lily was very happy with Max's idea and went to find a cat.
But then, something unexpected happened. When Lily found a cat, the cat started to chase Max! Max ran away, and the cat chased him all around the farm. In the end, Max and the cat became friends, and they all played together. Lily, Max, and the cat had lots of fun on the farm.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to eat melons. One day, she saw a big, fit melon in the market. She wanted it very much. But her mom said, "No, we have enough melons at home."
Mia was not happy. She started to scream and cry. Her mom felt sad but did not give in. They went home, and Mia was still upset. She did not talk to her mom and went to her room.
Later, Mia's mom came to her room with a melon from their home. She told Mia, "It is not nice to scream when you do not get what you want. We should be happy with what we have." Mia understood and said sorry to her mom. They ate the melon together and were happy. The moral of the story is to be grateful for what we have and not to scream when we don't get what we want.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was very obedient and always listened to his owner, Sarah. One day, Sarah and Max went for a walk in the woods. Max saw a squirrel and ran after it. Sarah called out to Max, "Max, come back this way!" Max didn't listen and kept running. Suddenly, Max came to a split in the path. He didn't know which way to go. Just then, Sarah caught up to him and said, "Max, you split away from me! Come back this way and stay obedient." Max wagged his tail and followed Sarah back home.

Once upon a time, there was a little circle. The circle was very independent. It liked to play by itself and did not mind being alone.
One day, the circle went for a walk. It met a square, a triangle, and a star. They all wanted to play together, but the circle did not mind playing alone.
After a while, the circle saw that the square, the triangle, and the star were having fun. The circle decided to join them. They all played together and had a great time. The circle learned that it was fun to be independent, but it was also fun to play with friends.

One day, a big dog named Max was playing in the park. Max saw a little girl with a sour face. She was sad because she hurt her leg. Max wanted to help her and make her happy.
Max went to the little girl and said, "I will protect you and make sure you don't hurt your leg again." The little girl smiled and said, "Thank you, Max." They played together in the park, and Max made sure she was safe.
Then, something unexpected happened. Max started to fly! The little girl was so surprised. Max said, "Now I can protect you even better!" They flew around the park together, and the little girl's leg felt better. They had a fun day, and Max was happy he could help his new friend.

Once upon a time, in a small town, a boy named Tim found a weapon. It was a stick. He thought it was a very cool stick. Tim wanted to show it to his friends. He thought they would think it was cool too.
Tim went to the park with his stick. He saw his friends playing. He showed them his weapon. His friends said, "That's a stupid stick, Tim!" They laughed at him. Tim felt sad. He didn't know what to do.
