One day, a big red car wanted to drive to the park. The car's name was Tommy. Tommy was a very safe car. He always made sure that everyone in the car was happy and safe.
On the way to the park, Tommy saw his friend, a small blue car named Billy. Billy was watching a TV in his car. Tommy said, "Hi, Billy! Do you want to come to the park with me?" Billy said, "Yes, Tommy! I love the park!"
So, Tommy and Billy drove to the park together. They were very safe and watched for other cars. At the park, they played with their car friends. They had so much fun! After playing, they drove home safely and watched TV together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the grocery store with her mom. They walked down the aisles and picked out some yummy snacks.
Suddenly, Lily saw a big, graceful swan outside the store. She ran to her mom and said, "Mommy, look at the pretty bird! Can we name her?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Sure, what should we name her?"
Lily thought for a moment and said, "Let's name her Grocery, because we saw her at the grocery store."
As they walked out of the store, they saw that the swan had followed them. It waddled behind them all the way home. When they got home, they realized that the swan had a tag on its leg with an address. They called the number and found out that the swan had escaped from a nearby zoo. The zookeeper came to pick up the swan and thanked Lily and her mom for finding her. They were happy to have helped the swan find her way back home.

Once upon a time, there was a little cell named Benny. He lived in a big body with lots of other cells. One day, a bad germ appeared in the body and started to make Benny and his friends sick.
Benny didn't know what to do. He felt scared and ignorant, like he didn't know anything. But then, he remembered something he had learned before. He knew that when bad things appear, you have to fight them.
So Benny and his friends worked together to fight the bad germ. They used all their strength to push it out of the body. It was hard work, but they did it! And soon, everyone was healthy again.
Benny felt proud of himself for helping to save the body. He realized that even though he was just a little cell, he could do big things when he worked together with his friends.

Once upon a time there was a family who had a fridge. The fridge was full of delicious food, but one day it started to get a little bit empty.
Mum and Dad added lots of food to the fridge, but still it was not full. So the family decided to add more food.
The family reached out for help from their neighbours and friends. Everyone added something special to the fridge. Before long, the fridge was full up again with lots of yummy food. 
The family were so happy that they could fill the fridge again. They were thankful for all the help they got, and felt less helpless now that the fridge was full.
The End.

Mummy and John were walking. John was excited.
"Why are you so happy John?" asked Mummy.
"We're going to the post office to give something," said John.
Mummy smiled. She knew what John meant. She was taking him to post a letter to Grandma.
At the post office, John opened his hands to give the letter to the lady. He was excited as he watched her post the letter in the box.
Mummy took John's hand and together, they walked away.
"The post box was very deep, wasn't it?" asked Mummy.
"Yes" agreed John. "And now, Grandma will get my letter!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to walk in the park with her mommy and daddy. One day, as they were walking, they saw a beautiful daisy. It was so pretty with its yellow petals and white center. Lily wanted to pick it up, but her mommy told her not to because it was unknown if it belonged to someone else.
As they continued their walk, they saw a man sitting on a bench. He looked sad and lonely. Lily's mommy and daddy went to talk to him and found out that he was new to the town and didn't know anyone. They invited him to join them on their walk and they all became friends. As they were walking back, the man noticed the daisy in Lily's hand and asked if he could have it. Lily happily gave it to him and he smiled, feeling happy again.
Lily learned that sometimes it's better to share and make new friends, even if it means giving away something special like the daisy. From that day on, whenever they went for a walk in the park, they would look for the man and he would always be there, waiting for them with a smile.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to ride on her bike. She went for rides every day and enjoyed the sunny weather. She loved to ride around with her friends.
One day, when she was out on her bike, she noticed a kitty by the side of the road. She stopped and smiled at him. The kitty was very shy, but he slowly crept closer to her.
The little girl said "Hi, kitty! Do you want to come for a ride with me?" The kitty meowed and hopped onto the bike.
They went on a long ride together, stopping by the river and a pond. Along the way, the kitty smiled and meowed with happiness. The little girl smiled too, glad that she had made a new friend. 
When they got back home, the kitty hopped off the bike, said goodbye and ran off again. The little girl waved goodbye and watched until the kitty had gone out of sight. She rode back home, happy that she had a special new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pink dress and a puppy named Max. Max was very cute and loved to play with Lily.
One day, Lily and Max went to the park to play. They saw a little bird singing on a tree. Lily said, "Max, look! The bird is singing!" Max barked happily.
Suddenly, Lily heard someone singing loudly. It was her friend, Sarah. Sarah came to the park to play with Lily and Max. "Hi Lily, hi Max! I love your pink dress, Lily," said Sarah. "Thanks, Sarah! Max loves to play with you," said Lily. Max barked happily again. They all played together and sang songs until it was time to go home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun and run around with her friends. One day, her mom told her it was time to take a shower because she was all sweaty. Lily didn't want to take a shower because she was having too much fun, but her mom said it was important to stay clean and healthy.
While Lily was taking her shower, she accidentally dropped her soap and it made a loud noise. She felt clumsy and embarrassed, but her mom told her it was okay and to ignore the accident. After the shower, Lily felt fresh and clean and was glad she listened to her mom. She went back outside to play with her friends, feeling happy and refreshed. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his baseball all day long. One day, Timmy's mom bought him a new baseball. Timmy was so happy that he ran to his room to unpack it.
As he was unpacking his baseball, his mom came in and said, "Timmy, it's time for dinner." Timmy replied, "Okay, Mommy. I will be obedient and come to dinner soon."
After dinner, Timmy went outside to play with his new baseball. He threw it up in the air and caught it. Suddenly, his neighbor came over and asked, "Can I play with you, Timmy?" Timmy said, "Sure, let's play catch together!" They played catch until it was time for bed. Timmy went to sleep with his obedient dog by his side, dreaming about playing with his new baseball again tomorrow. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to wear her pink coat whenever she went outside to play. One day, she was playing in the park when she saw a man with a smelly coat. 
"Excuse me, sir. Why is your coat so smelly?" Lily asked.
The man didn't answer her question and just walked away. Lily didn't understand why he didn't answer her. 
Later that day, Lily's mom took her to the store to buy some candy. As they were walking home, they saw the man with the smelly coat again. This time, he was running away from the police. 
Lily was scared and didn't know what was happening. Her mom quickly grabbed her hand and they ran away. When they got home, Lily asked her mom why the man was running. 
Her mom answered sadly, "He did something bad and now he has to go to jail." 
Lily didn't understand why the man didn't answer her earlier. She felt sad and confused.

Once upon a time, there was a big party. All of the animals were invited. The invitation said it was important to come. The party was in a big field with lots of flowers.
The rabbit was very excited to go to the party. He put on his best clothes and hopped to the field. When he got there, he saw that there was not enough food for everyone. The rabbit decided to yield his food to the other animals so they could all eat.
Everyone was very happy and had a great time at the party. The rabbit felt proud that he could help his friends. From then on, the other animals knew that the rabbit was a kind and generous friend.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a long day at school and he was very tired. When he got home, he saw his little sister playing with his favorite toy. Timmy asked his sister if he could play with the toy, but his sister said "no".
Timmy got upset and told his sister to give him the toy. But his sister ignored him and kept playing. Timmy then went to his room and saw a frame on his desk. He picked it up and threw it on the ground. His mom heard the noise and asked what happened. Timmy said his sister wouldn't give him the toy and that he was mad.
His mom told Timmy to calm down and that he shouldn't break things. Timmy ignored his mom and went back to his sister's room. He grabbed the toy and started playing with it. But then, the toy broke and Timmy got sad. His mom came in and said "I told you not to break things, now you can't play with the toy anymore". Timmy learned his lesson and promised to never ignore his mom again.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They needed to buy some food for dinner. Tim liked going to the store because he could help his mom pick out the things they needed. He felt like a big boy when he did this.
At the store, Tim saw a big, round ball that he really wanted. His mom said he could have it if he put it back in its original place when they got home. Tim was very happy and agreed to do this. He held the ball tight as they walked around the store.
When they got home, Tim played with the ball in the yard. He had so much fun! But then, he remembered what his mom said. He needed to put the ball back in its original place. So, Tim put the ball away and went inside to help his mom make dinner. He felt proud that he kept his promise.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a coin. He liked to play with his coin. One day, he went outside to play. He wanted to try to throw the coin in the air. Tim threw the coin up high. The coin went up, up, up.
While the coin was in the air, Tim felt dizzy. He fell down on the grass. The coin came down too. But it did not fall on the grass. It fell in a big tree. Tim was sad. He wanted his coin back. He tried to get up, but he still felt dizzy.
Then, a big bird came. The bird saw the coin in the tree. The bird took the coin in its beak. Tim thought the bird would fly away with his coin. But the bird flew down to Tim. The bird gave the coin back to Tim. Tim was so happy. He said thank you to the bird. And they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to look at the stars at night. One day, she saw a shooting star and made a wish. She wished to have a puppy. Her parents said she had to be patient and wait for the right time.
Lily was sad but decided to test her patience. She waited and waited. A few weeks later, her parents surprised her with a cute little puppy. Lily was so happy and grateful for her new friend. She learned that good things come to those who are patient.
The moral of the story is that sometimes we have to wait for what we want, but it will be worth it in the end. Just like how Lily had to wait to get her puppy, we must be patient and trust that good things will come our way. And when they do, we should be grateful and appreciate them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up and wear her fancy suits. Her mom always told her to be wise and make good choices.
One day, Lily's mom asked her to pour some milk into her cereal bowl. Lily was so excited to help that she poured too much milk and it spilled all over the table. Her mom said, "Don't worry, accidents happen. Just be more careful next time."
Later that day, Lily and her mom went to the park. As they were walking, Lily saw a big puddle on the ground. Her mom warned her not to step in it or she would get her suit dirty. Lily remembered what her mom said about being wise and made sure to avoid the puddle.
As they were leaving the park, Lily saw a man carrying a heavy box. She remembered how her mom said to always help others when you can. So, Lily ran over and offered to help him carry the box. The man was grateful and thanked Lily for being so wise and kind.

Once upon a time, there was a mommy named Sarah. She had a pretty purse that she carried with her everywhere she went. One day, she went to the store to buy some milk and cookies for her little girl. But when she got home, she realized she forgot her purse at the store! She was very sad because her purse had all her money and important things inside. 
Sarah's little girl saw how sad her mommy was and wanted to help. She said, "Don't worry mommy, we will go back to the store and find your purse. It's not lost, it's just waiting for us to come get it!" So, they went back to the store and Sarah's purse was there, safe and sound. Sarah was very happy and gave her little girl a big hug for helping her find her purse. 
From that day on, Sarah always made sure to double check that she had her purse with her before leaving the store. And her little girl felt very proud that she helped her mommy when she forgot something. The end.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a popular cow named Momo. Momo was very nice and always made people laugh. Momo loved to dance and clap her hooves. Everyone loved Momo.
One day, Momo met a little boy named Tim. Tim was sad because he had no friends. Momo said, "Hi, Tim! Do you want to be my friend?" Tim looked at Momo and smiled. "Yes, Momo! I'd love to be your friend!" They played and danced together. Tim clapped his hands while Momo clapped her hooves. They had so much fun.
Later, Momo and Tim were hungry. Momo's mom had cooked some steak for them. Tim looked at the steak and said, "Momo, I can't eat this. I like you too much!" Momo smiled and said, "That's okay, Tim. We can eat something else." They ate some yummy fruits instead. From that day on, Tim and Momo were best friends. They learned that being kind and caring makes you popular and loved by others.

Tim and Sam were friends who liked to swim in the pond. They had a game where they would dive under the water and see who could stay longer. They would take a big breath and fill their lungs with air, then go down and count in their heads.
One day, Tim had a foolish idea. He wanted to dive deeper than Sam and find a big rock. He said to Sam, "I bet I can dive deeper than you and bring back a big rock. Do you dare me?"
Sam did not think it was a good idea. He said, "No, Tim, that is too dangerous. You might hurt yourself or run out of air. The pond is very deep and dark. We should stay near the surface where we can see and breathe."
But Tim did not listen to Sam. He said, "You are just scared. I am not. Watch me." He took a very big breath and dove under the water. He swam down and down, looking for a big rock. He did not see how far he was going or how long he was under.
Sam waited for Tim to come back. He counted to ten, then to twenty, then to thirty. He started to worry. He said, "Tim, where are you? Come back, Tim, come back!" He looked under the water, but he could not see Tim. He felt scared and sad.
Tim finally found a big rock. He was happy and proud. He grabbed the rock and tried to swim back up. But the rock was very heavy and Tim was very tired. He felt his lungs burning and his head spinning. He realized he had made a foolish mistake. He wished he had listened to Sam. He dropped the rock and tried to swim faster, but it was too late. He could not reach the surface. He could not breathe. He closed his eyes and sank into the dark.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a diary where she wrote about her day. Her diary was very popular among her friends. 
One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. There, she saw a big dog staring at her. She got scared and ran to her mom. Her mom told her not to be afraid and that the dog was friendly. 
Lily went back to playing and forgot about the dog. When she got home, she wrote about the dog in her diary. She was excited to tell her friends about her adventure at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly dog named Max. Max loved to play with his ball and go for walks with his owner, Sarah. One day, Sarah had to go to work and couldn't take Max with her. 
Max was sad and didn't know what to do. He went to his friend, a cat named Lily, to ask for help. "Lily, I'm sad. Sarah is at work and I miss her. What can I do?" asked Max. 
Lily thought for a moment and then said, "Let's make a card for Sarah! We can draw pictures and write a message to tell her how much we love her." Max thought that was a great idea and they got to work. 
They drew pictures of themselves playing and wrote a message that said, "We miss you, Sarah. Love, Max and Lily." When Sarah came home from work, she was so happy to see the card. "Thank you, Max and Lily! You are such good friends," she said. Max was happy too, knowing that he had helped make Sarah's day a little brighter.

Once upon a time, there was a rich man who went to the grocery store. He bought lots of yummy food and put them in his bag. When he left the store, he saw a little girl crying. He asked her why she was sad. She said she lost her toy.
The rich man wanted to help the little girl, so he lied and said he saw her toy at the grocery store. They went back to the store and looked for the toy. They found it under a shelf! The little girl was so happy and hugged the rich man.
The rich man felt happy too because he helped someone. He realized that being wealthy is not just about having lots of money, but also about having a kind heart. From that day on, he would always help people in need.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a doll that was very unusual. This doll could talk! Sue loved her doll and played with it every day.
One day, Sue and her doll went to the park. They set the doll on a bench to rest. Sue went to play with her friends. When Sue came back, she saw a boy holding her doll. The boy said the doll was his. Sue was sad and didn't know what to do.
Then, the unusual doll spoke up and said, "Sue, please share me with the boy." Sue thought about it and decided to share her doll with the boy. They both played with the doll and had lots of fun. Sue learned that sharing can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside on the grassy lawn. One day, she found a long, flexible stick. She picked it up and started to wave it around.
Suddenly, she saw a shiny red apple on a tree. She wanted to eat it, but it was too high up for her to reach. She tried jumping, but she still couldn't get it.
Then, she had an idea. She used the flexible stick to reach the apple and pulled it down. She took a big bite and it was delicious! From that day on, Lily always kept her flexible stick with her in case she needed to reach something high. The end.

Once, a cat and a dog lived in a small house. They were good friends. One day, they saw a big box with a sign on it. The sign had a picture of a big bone and a fish. The cat and the dog wanted to see what was inside the box.
The cat tried to fit into the box, but it was too tight. The dog tried too, but it was also too tight for him. They both wanted to get inside the box and find the bone and the fish. They tried to push and pull, but the box did not open.
The cat and the dog thought of a plan. They went to their friend, the mouse. They asked the mouse to help them. The mouse was small and could fit into the box. The mouse went inside the box and got the bone and the fish for the cat and the dog. They were all very happy and shared the treats. The cat, the dog, and the mouse became even better friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she went to the park to play on the swings. She went very fast and it was so quick! 
After she was done swinging, she wanted to go down the slide. But the slide was wet from the rain and she didn't want to get wet. So she waited for the sun to come out and dry the slide. Finally, the sun came out and the slide was dry. Lily was happy and completed her slide adventure. 
She then went to the sandbox to build a castle. She worked very hard and completed her castle in no time. She was so proud of herself for completing it so quickly. The end.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a little bunny named Ben. Ben loved to hop and play with his friends. One sunny day, Ben went on an adventure to discover new things.
As Ben hopped deeper into the forest, he saw a big, scary, and dangerous snake. The snake said, "Hello, little bunny. Come and touch my shiny skin." But Ben knew that it was not safe to touch the snake.
Ben said, "No, thank you, Mr. Snake. I must go and find my friends." And with that, Ben hopped away as fast as he could. He found his friends and told them about the dangerous snake. They all agreed to stay away and play in a safer part of the forest.
From that day on, Ben and his friends had lots of fun and stayed away from the dangerous snake. They discovered new places to play and made many happy memories together. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Bun Bun. One day, Bun Bun was walking in the forest when he saw a fancy hat on the ground. He picked it up and put it on his head. "Look at me! I'm so fancy!" Bun Bun exclaimed.
Suddenly, he heard a voice saying, "Shh, be quiet!" It was a wise old owl. "Why do I have to be quiet?" asked Bun Bun. "Because sometimes silence is better than noise," replied the owl.
Bun Bun thought about what the owl said and realized that sometimes it's better to be quiet and listen. From that day on, Bun Bun learned to jump and play quietly, and he always remembered the wise old owl's advice. The moral of the story is that sometimes it's important to be quiet and listen, even when we want to be fancy and loud.

Once upon a time, in a distant land, there was a mom and her daughter. They lived in a small house near a big tree. The mom always hoped for the best for her little girl. One day, the daughter saw a pretty butterfly and wanted to catch it.
"Mom, can I catch the butterfly, please?" the daughter asked. The mom said, "Yes, but be careful and don't go too far." The daughter ran after the butterfly, laughing and having fun. The butterfly flew far away, but the daughter did not stop.
The mom started to worry and called out, "Daughter, come back!" But the daughter did not hear her mom. She kept running after the butterfly. The mom felt sad and hoped her daughter would come back soon.
The sky turned dark and it started to rain. The mom looked for her daughter, but she was lost. The daughter never came back, and the mom was very sad. She always hoped that one day, her daughter would find her way back home. But she never did.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mom in the kitchen. One day, her mom asked her to stir the soup. Lily was happy to help and used a big spoon to stir the soup.
After they finished cooking, they went to the store to buy some things. Lily saw some shiny coins on the ground and picked them up. She showed them to her mom and her mom explained that it was money. Lily was excited and wanted to keep it.
At the store, they met a polite man who held the door open for them. Lily's mom thanked him and said he was very polite. Lily smiled and said, "I like polite people." They bought what they needed and went back home, happy and grateful for the kind man and the fun day they had.

The sun was out and it was warm and bright. The air was cool.
Sam and his dad were in the garden and Sam wanted to go and explore. His dad said it would be a good idea, but he had to stay close by. 
Sam ran across the lawn and across the field until he reached the edge of the forest. The trees were tall and wide and the sun was making the leaves look green and cool. Sam stepped into the woods and it felt like a different world.
Suddenly, Sam heard a strange noise. He froze. Then he heard it again. It sounded like a big animal. Sam started to back away. 
Then he heard his dad's voice. "Don't worry Sam. It's just a deer. You can come and have a look, but stay safe!
Sam felt brave. He slowly walked towards the noise. He was amazed when he thought he saw something move. He stepped closer and then he saw it – a beautiful deer, standing in the cool forest. 
Sam and the deer looked into each other's eyes. Sam felt so happy. For a moment, he felt like he had become one with the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a big mountain with lots of snow on top. The snow was so high that nobody could climb up to the top. One day, a kind man came with a big machine to restore the mountain. He used the machine to move the snow from the top of the mountain to the bottom. 
The man worked very hard and soon the snow was gone from the top of the mountain. Now, everyone could climb up to the top and see the beautiful view. The man was very happy because he helped people to see the top of the mountain. 
From that day on, the mountain was a happy place where people could play and have fun. The man was a hero for restoring the mountain and making it a better place for everyone.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a naughty boy named Tim. Tim did not like to sleep. Every night, he would stay awake and play with his toys. His mom and dad would tell him to go to bed, but he would not listen.
One day, a big storm came to the town. It was a hurricane. The wind blew hard, and the rain fell down. Everyone in the town was scared. Tim's mom and dad told him they needed to hide and be safe from the hurricane.
Tim was scared too. He wanted to be brave, but he was very tired. He had not slept for many nights. So, Tim decided to listen to his mom and dad. He went to bed and tried to sleep. The hurricane was loud, but Tim was so tired that he fell asleep. When he woke up, the hurricane was gone, and everything was okay. Tim learned that sleep is important, and he promised to be a good boy and go to bed when his mom and dad told him to.

Once upon a time, there was a family of frogs who lived together beside a lake. All the frogs liked to splash in the lake and eat the healthy onions that grew on the banks. One day, one of the frogs wanted to take more onions than his brothers and sisters. He wanted to take all the onions and keep them for himself. 
The other frogs said no and tried to stop him, but the greedy frog was very strong and grabbed the onions. Then the family of frogs argued and shouted and the lake was starting to get very scared. 
The lake then started to splash and splash, and the greedy frog dropped the onions in the water. The lake smiled and the onions floated away. The frog family sighed with relief and enjoyed their healthy onions together. From then on, the family of frogs shared the onions equally, and the lake was happy to splash with them.

Once upon a time, there was a wise alligator. He lived in a big pond with his friends, the ducks and the fish. One day, the alligator saw a big rock in the middle of the pond. He wanted to move it, so he pushed and pushed with all his might. Finally, the rock moved and the alligator was very happy. His friends were proud of him too! From that day on, the alligator knew that he was strong and wise.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, Lily's mom told her it was time to clean up. Lily didn't want to because it was hard. But her mom said it would be easy if she helped.
Lily started picking up all her toys and putting them in the toy box. She found a few things under her bed and put them away too. It took a little while, but finally, they were all picked up. Lily was happy because she knew she did a good job.
At the end of the day, Lily was tired but proud of herself. She learned that cleaning up can be easy if you help and that it feels good when you finish.

Once there was an ordinary boy. His name was Tom and he was three years old. Tom wanted to be very smart, so he asked his parents for a tutor. 
His parents thought it was a great idea, so they added a tutor to help him. The tutor was very kind and she had lots of patience. She taught Tom all kinds of things, like numbers and the alphabet. 
At the end of every lesson, the tutor would give Tom treats as a reward. Tom loved his tutor, and he was getting smarter every day. He was so happy, and he was proud of himself. 
The end.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mommy. Lily saw a big, shiny slide made of metal. She wanted to go on it, but her mommy said, "Not yet, we have to prepare for lunch first."
Lily and her mommy sat on a bench and ate sandwiches. Lily's sandwich had a lot of fat ham in it, which she loved. Suddenly, a boy came and said, "I want to go on the slide too!" But Lily's mommy said, "Sorry, we're not done with lunch yet."
The boy got angry and started to cry. Lily felt sad for him, so she said, "It's okay, we can share the slide." The boy stopped crying and smiled. Lily and the boy played together on the slide and had a lot of fun. They learned that sharing is important and that friends can solve conflicts together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures and hang them up in her room. One day, she drew a picture of her family and wanted to put it in a frame. But she didn't have a frame that fit her picture.
Lily thought, "I need a frame that is the right size for my picture." She looked all over her room for a frame that would fit, but none of them were the right size.
The next day, Lily's mom surprised her with a new frame. It was the perfect size for her picture! Lily was so happy and put her picture in the frame. Now her picture looked normal, just like all the other pictures in her room. She was proud of her picture and happy to have a new frame.

Once upon a time, there was a busy park. In the park, there was a big slide. Kids loved to play on the slide all day. One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park with her mom.
Mia was scared of the slide, but her mom said, "Trust me, it's fun!" Mia watched the other kids play on the slide. She saw them laugh and have fun. So, Mia decided to try the slide too.
Mia climbed to the top of the slide. Just as she was about to slide down, a little puppy appeared at the bottom! The puppy wanted to play too. Mia and the puppy took turns on the slide and became best friends. The busy park was always full of fun surprises.

Once upon a time, there was a king who lived in a big castle. He had a crown on his head and a big castle to live in. The king had many helpers who did things for him. One of the helpers was a reliable man who always did what he was supposed to do.
One day, the reliable man saw a big storm coming. He knew it was going to be dangerous for the king. He ran to the castle to warn the king about the storm. The king listened to the reliable man and went inside the castle to be safe.
The storm was very strong and blew things around. But the king was safe because he listened to the reliable man's warning. From that day on, the king knew that he could always trust the reliable man to keep him safe. And they all lived happily ever after. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to show her toys to her friends. One day, she found a cheap, pretty basket in her room.
Sue put her toys in the basket and walked to her friend Tim's house. She wanted to show him her cheap, pretty basket full of toys. On the way, she saw a big, friendly dog. The dog wagged its tail and licked her hand.
Sue and the dog walked to Tim's house together. When they got there, Sue showed Tim her cheap, pretty basket full of toys. Tim was so happy to see Sue and her basket. They played with the toys all day, and the big friendly dog played with them too.

One day, there was a row of toys lying on the floor. There were dolls, books, stuffed animals and more. Everyone was quiet in the room.
Suddenly, a loud noise came. A boy with a big smile on his face had come into the room. He was 3 years old. He grabbed a toy and started playing with it.
Then he grabbed another toy, followed by another and another. Pretty soon, he had grabbed all of the toys in the row. He would play with each one one after the other. He was shouting and laughing loudly.
Soon it was time to go. He put the toys back in the row. Then he hugged them goodbye and waved to them. He smiled and ran out of the room, still making loud noises.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a restless boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside and wave at everyone he saw. One sunny day, he went to the park to play.
At the park, Tim saw a girl named Sue. She was holding a long stick called a measure. Sue was using the measure to see how far she could jump. Tim thought it looked like fun, so he went over to join her.
"Hi, Sue! Can I play too?" Tim asked, waving at her. Sue smiled and said, "Of course! Let's see who can jump the farthest!" They took turns jumping and measuring. They had so much fun together. From that day on, Tim and Sue became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to hug her teddy bear every night before going to bed. One day, as she was walking in the park, she saw a boy who looked very sad. She went up to him and gave him a big hug. The boy smiled and thanked her.
Suddenly, a big, mean dog came running towards them. The boy was deaf and couldn't hear the dog barking. Lily quickly grabbed the boy's hand and they ran away. As they were running, they saw a man trying to steal a lady's purse. 
Lily had an idea. She ran up to the man and gave him a big hug. The man was so surprised that he dropped the purse and ran away. The lady was very grateful and gave Lily a big hug too. Lily and the boy walked home, feeling very happy that they helped someone in need.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily wanted to buy a sweater. She had a big piggy bank full of coins. She saved a lot so she could buy a very special sweater.
One day, she went to the store with her mom. There, she saw a powerful red sweater. The sweater was soft and warm. Lily knew that this was the perfect sweater for her.
Lily used her coins to buy the powerful red sweater. She wore it every day and felt so happy. The red sweater made her feel strong and special. And that is the story of Lily and her powerful red sweater.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. It was winter and there was a lot of snow outside. Timmy wanted to play in the snow, but his mommy said it was too bad outside. Timmy was sad.
He decided to ask his daddy if he could play in the snow. His daddy said yes, but only if he wore his warm coat and boots. Timmy put on his coat and boots and went outside to play.
He made a snowman and threw snowballs. It was so much fun! When he got cold, he went back inside and drank hot cocoa with his mommy and daddy. Timmy was happy he decided to go outside and play in the snow. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a fat dog named Spot. He loved to play and run in the park. One day, he found a big bone under a tree. Spot was very happy and picked it up with his mouth.
Spot saw his friend, a cat named Fluffy, and said, "Look, Fluffy! I found a big bone!" Fluffy looked at the bone and said, "Wow, Spot! That is a big bone! What will you do with it?"
Spot thought for a moment and said, "I will wrap it in a soft cloth and hide it in my house. That way, I can eat it later when I am hungry." So, Spot took the bone home, wrapped it in a soft cloth, and hid it under his bed.
The next day, Spot went to play in the park again. He was very happy knowing that he had a big bone waiting for him at home. And from that day on, Spot always remembered to wrap his bones and save them for later.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Tim. Tim liked to play outside. One day, he saw his shadow on the ground. He said, "Hello, shadow! Let's play together!"
Tim and his shadow played all day. They ran, jumped, and climbed trees. But then, the sky became dark. Tim's shadow became big and scary. Tim was scared and said, "Shadow, please become small again!"
Just then, a friendly cat came to Tim. The cat said, "Don't be scared, Tim. I will help you." The cat stood in front of the big shadow. The shadow became small again. Tim was happy and said, "Thank you, cat!" Tim and the cat played together until the sun came back. From that day on, they were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to collect shiny things. One day, she found a crystal in the park and she was so happy. She showed it to her friend, Timmy, who also loved shiny things. Timmy wanted to have the crystal too, but Lily didn't want to give it to him.
"I found it first," said Lily. "I want to keep it."
Timmy was sad and didn't know what to do. He wanted to be successful in getting the crystal, but Lily wouldn't give it to him. Suddenly, Lily had an idea.
"I will lead you to a secret spot where we can find more crystals," said Lily. "Then we can both have lots of shiny things!"
Timmy was excited and followed Lily to the secret spot. They found lots of crystals and were both successful in getting shiny things. They were happy and played together, sharing their crystals and having fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, she decided to go for a walk with her mommy. They walked a long way and saw many pretty flowers and trees.
As they walked, Lily noticed her mommy's hair was messy. She said, "Mommy, your hair is not tidy." Her mommy laughed and said, "You're right, Lily. I need to brush it." So, they stopped and her mommy brushed her hair until it was neat and tidy.
After that, they continued their walk and came across a big field. Lily wanted to run and play, so she started to stretch her arms and legs. Her mommy joined in and they both stretched their bodies before running and playing in the field. It was a fun day for Lily and her mommy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy was very gifted and loved to play in the park. One day, Timmy's mom gave him a prune to eat while they played. Timmy didn't like prunes, but he ate it anyway.
While they were playing, Timmy saw a little girl crying. He went up to her and asked, "What's wrong?" The little girl said she lost her mommy. Timmy said he would help her find her mommy. They searched all over the park, but they couldn't find her mommy.
As it started to get dark, Timmy's mom came to pick him up. Timmy told his mom about the little girl who lost her mommy. His mom said they would have to leave and come back the next day to help her. Timmy was sad and said goodbye to the little girl.
The next day, Timmy and his mom went back to the park to look for the little girl. They couldn't find her anywhere. Timmy was very sad and wished he could have helped her find her mommy.

Molly had been playing with her dolls all day. She was getting very tired. Molly's mom said it was time for bed. Molly went over to her bed and started folding the blankets. She always folded them the same way every evening so it was very dependable. 
Molly was so tired that she was ready to fall asleep before she finished folding. She looked around her room and saw the fireplace. Mommy always lit it for her on cold nights. Usually, when the fireplace was lit, it was the sign that she should get under the covers.
Molly was happy to put her folded blankets down onto the bed and crawl under the covers. She thought that the fireplace was so dependable and like a friend to her. It always made her room feel cozy and warm and she knew it was time to go to sleep when she saw the flames. Molly closed her eyes and was soon dreaming.

Once upon a time, there was a big round ball. The ball was very jealous of the other toys. It did not like that the kids played with the other toys more. One day, the ball said, "I want to play too. Let me play with the kids."
The kids said, "Yes, let's play with the round ball!" They played with the ball all day. The ball was very happy. But then, something unexpected happened. The ball got a hole in it. The kids were sad and the ball was sad too.
The kids tried to fix the round ball, but they could not. The ball was too jealous and did not let the kids play with the other toys. In the end, the kids could not play with the ball anymore. The ball was sad and alone, and the kids played with their other toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys, but she always made a messy room. One day, her mom came in and said, "Lily, you need to clean up your toys."
Lily replied, "But Mommy, I want to play with them more."
Mommy said, "I'll allow you to play with them more if you clean up your room first."
Lily thought about it and decided to clean up her room. She picked up all her toys and put them away neatly. When she was done, her mommy gave her a trophy for being such a good helper.
Lily was so happy and proud of her trophy. She said, "Thank you, Mommy! I love my trophy!"

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant named Ellie. Ellie was glad because she had many friends in the jungle. One day, Ellie met a bird named Billy. "Hello, Billy!" said Ellie. "Hello, Ellie!" said Billy. "I can soar high in the sky. Do you want to come with me?" asked Billy. "Yes, I want to soar too!" said Ellie. 
So, Billy and Ellie soared high in the sky. Ellie felt very happy and she trumpeted with joy. Suddenly, Ellie felt a pain in her tummy. "Oh no, I think I ate something bad," said Ellie. "Let's go back to the jungle," said Billy. 
When they reached the jungle, Ellie felt very sick. Her friends tried to help her, but it was too late. Ellie had eaten a bad thing and she died. Billy was very sad. "I'm sorry, Ellie. I wish I could have helped you more," said Billy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big pie contest in a small town. All the people wanted to win the contest. They were very competitive.
One day, a girl named Lucy wanted to make the best pie. She attached a note to her pie that said, "The best pie ever!" But her friend, Tim, also wanted to win the contest. He saw Lucy's pie and got mad.
Tim thought of a plan. He took Lucy's pie and hid it. When it was time for the contest, Lucy could not find her pie. She was very sad. Tim won the contest with his pie, but everyone knew what he did. They were not happy with Tim, and he felt bad for what he did. In the end, nobody was happy.

One day, a girl named Amy went to a store with her mom. Amy saw a pretty bottle with a nice smell. The bottle had a word on it that said "perfume." Amy asked her mom if she could get it. Her mom said yes, so Amy was very happy.
When they got home, Amy went to her room and put the perfume on. Then, something unknown and strange happened. Amy entered a new world with lots of colors and fun things to do. She played with new friends and had a great time.
But then, Amy started to miss her mom. She wanted to go back home. Amy's new friends told her the secret to leave their world was to put on more perfume. So, Amy put on more perfume and entered back into her room. She was happy to be home and hugged her mom tight.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big party coming up and she wanted to decorate her house. She asked her mommy to help her. Together, they put up balloons and streamers all around the house. They also hung up some pictures on the wall.
Lily's mommy then took out some nail polish and painted Lily's nails. Lily loved how pretty her nails looked. She felt like a princess. 
At the party, Lily's friends came over and they played games and ate yummy food. They also saw how healthy the snacks were. They had fruits and veggies, which are good for their bodies. Everyone had so much fun and Lily was happy that her house looked so pretty.
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park near her house. One

Once upon a time, there was a healthy alligator. He was swimming around in the pond near his home. One day, he was taking a peek out of the water and saw a boy on the shore. The alligator was curious; he had never seen a boy before.
The alligator slowly swam closer to get a better look. Just when he was about to peek out again, the boy screamed! Startled, the alligator quickly swam away. He was scared and wanted to get back to where he was safe.
The boy was scared too, but more because of what happened next. Suddenly, a big, fierce alligator stepped out of the shadows. He was angry that the other alligator had been so close. He growled and popped out his teeth.
The healthy alligator was frightened. He didn't want to get in a fight with the fierce alligator. After a few moments, the healthy alligator slowly crept away and went back to his pond. He was relieved that he was safe again. He promised himself that he wouldn't take such a big peek ever again.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a cheerful boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his red flag. He would run around the park with his flag, waving it high in the air.
One day, while Tim was playing with his flag, a big dog came up to him. The dog wanted to play too. "Woof, woof!" said the dog. Tim was scared, but he let the dog play with his flag. They ran around the park together, having fun.
But then, the dog got too excited. It jumped up and grabbed Tim's flag with its teeth. The dog began to pull on the flag, and Tim tried to hold on. "No, no!" cried Tim. But it was too late. The dog had torn Tim's flag.
Tim was very sad. His red flag was his favorite toy, and now it was ruined. He went home, crying to his mom. She hugged him and tried to make him feel better, but Tim's heart was broken. The cheerful boy was no more, and the town lost a little bit of its joy that day.

One day, a girl named Lily went to the beach with her mom. They walked on the sand and saw many things like shells and rocks. Suddenly, Lily saw a blue jellyfish in the water. She said, "Mommy, look! A blue jellyfish! I love it!" 
Her mom said, "Be careful, sweetie. Jellyfish can sting you." Then they continued to walk on the beach. But then, Lily saw something unexpected. She saw a little crab crawling on her foot! She screamed, "Mommy, help! A crab is on my foot!" 
Her mom picked up the crab and put it back in the water. Lily was scared but also happy that the crab was okay. She said, "I love the beach, but I don't want any more surprises!" They continued to walk and enjoy the beach together.

Tom and Sue were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. They saw a big dog with brown fur and a long tail. The dog was barking and running towards them.
"Look, a dog!" Tom said. "Do you know him?"
Sue shook her head. She did not recognize the dog. She was frightened. She did not like big dogs that barked. She grabbed Tom's hand and ran away.
"Help, help!" Sue cried. "The dog is chasing us!"
They ran to the bench where their mom was sitting. She saw them and the dog. She stood up and waved her arms.
"Go away, dog!" she shouted. "Leave my children alone!"
The dog stopped and looked at her. He wagged his tail and ran to another person. He was not a bad dog. He just wanted to play.
Tom and Sue hugged their mom. They were glad she was there. She kissed them and smiled.
"Are you okay, my loves?" she asked.
"Yes, mom," Tom said. "But we were scared."
"I know, sweetie," she said. "But you are safe now. The dog is gone. He did not mean to frighten you."
She checked her watch. It was time to go home. She took their hands and walked with them.
"Let's go, kids," she said. "It's time for dinner. How about some pizza?"
Tom and Sue cheered. They liked pizza. They forgot about the dog. They were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Nemo. Nemo was very hungry and wanted to eat something yummy. He swam and swam until he saw a jellyfish. Nemo thought the jellyfish looked yummy, but he didn't know that jellyfish were not good to eat.
Nemo took a bite of the jellyfish, but it tasted very bad. He felt sick and his tummy hurt. Suddenly, an ugly shark appeared and wanted to eat Nemo! Nemo swam as fast as he could to get away from the shark.
Nemo learned a lesson that day. He realized that just because something looks yummy, it doesn't mean it's good to eat. He also learned that he should be careful of ugly sharks. From that day on, Nemo only ate things he knew were safe and yummy.

Once upon a time, there was a little motor. It was a very flexible motor. It could do many things. The motor had many friends who liked to play with it. They played all day long, and the motor was very happy.
One day, a new friend came to play with the motor. The new friend did not know how to play with the flexible motor. The new friend asked, "Can you show me how to play with the motor?" The other friends said, "Yes, we can show you."
They all played together and showed the new friend how to use the flexible motor. The new friend was very happy and thanked the other friends for helping. They all had a great time playing with the motor.
The moral of the story is to always be kind and help others when they ask. By helping others, we can all have fun and be happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a red backpack with a zipper that she loved to play with. One day, she went to school and met a new friend named Timmy. Timmy had big, nosy eyes and always asked a lot of questions.
During class, Lily noticed that her pencil case was missing. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. Timmy saw her looking and asked, "What's wrong, Lily?" She replied, "My pencil case is gone. I can't find it anywhere." Suddenly, Timmy's big, nosy eyes spotted something under his desk. It was Lily's pencil case! He had accidentally taken it when he grabbed his own backpack earlier.
Lily was so happy to have her pencil case back. She said, "Thank you, Timmy! You're a good pupil." Timmy smiled and replied, "No problem, Lily. I'm glad I could help." From then on, Lily and Timmy were the best of friends and always made sure to double-check their backpacks before leaving school.

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy little boy named Tim. Tim was always falling and bumping into things. One day, Tim was playing outside with his big red ball. While he was running, he tripped and fell on his knee. It hurt a lot and he started to cry.
His mom heard him crying and came outside. She saw Tim's hurt knee and gave him a big hug. She put a band-aid on his knee and kissed it better. Tim felt much better and said, "Thank you, Mommy."
After that, Tim tried to be more careful when he played. He didn't want to hurt his knee again. He still had fun, but he wasn't as clumsy as before. And every time he remembered to be careful, he said, "Thank you, knee."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a secret hiding spot under her bed where she kept her favorite toys. One day, Lily's little brother found out about her secret spot and tried to take her toys. But Lily was tough and she didn't let him take them.
Later that day, Lily and her brother went to the park to play. Lily's brother found a big rock and started to climb it. Lily wanted to record her brother climbing the rock, so she took out her phone and pressed the button to start recording. Her brother was so happy when he saw the video and wanted to watch it over and over again. From that day on, Lily and her brother played together and had lots of fun, but Lily always kept her secret hiding spot safe.

Once upon a time, there was a small caterpillar named Carl. Carl was very poor and hungry. He lived in a tiny house made of leaves.
One sunny day, Carl was crawling around the park. He saw a big cake on a table. Carl went to the cake and said, "I want to eat this cake!" He started to demand a piece of the cake.
Just then, a big bird came and took the cake away. Carl was sad and hungry. But then, something unexpected happened. The bird dropped the cake from the sky, and it fell right into Carl's tiny house.
Carl was so happy! He ate the cake and shared it with his friends. From that day on, poor Carl was not hungry anymore. And he learned that sometimes, good things happen when you least expect them.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max loved to go for walks with his owner, Sarah. Every day, Sarah would put Max's leash on and they would go for a walk around the neighborhood. Max was always so happy to be outside with Sarah.
One day, Sarah told Max that they were going on a trip. Max didn't know what a trip was, but he knew it sounded exciting. Sarah started to pack a bag with Max's regular food, toys, and his leash. Max was confused why Sarah was packing his leash, but he didn't mind. 
The next day, Sarah and Max got in the car and drove for a long time. Max was getting sleepy, but he didn't want to close his eyes and miss anything. Finally, they arrived at a big park with lots of trees and grass. Sarah took Max's leash out of the bag and put it on him. Max was so happy to be outside in a new place with his regular leash. He knew it was going to be a great trip.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a broken toy car. It was very old and not pretty. Lily wanted to make the toy car incredible again. She thought, "I will restore it and give it a new style!"
Lily took the toy car to her dad. "Dad, can you help me fix this car?" she asked. Her dad smiled and said, "Of course, Lily! Let's make it incredible together."
They worked together to fix the toy car. They painted it with bright colors and added fun stickers. The toy car now had a new style! Lily was so happy. She played with her incredible toy car all day long.

One day, a little rabbit named Bob was very eager. He wanted to go find a big, red radish to eat. He hopped and hopped until he saw a radish in a garden.
Bob was so happy. He tried to pull the radish out of the ground. But, the radish was very big and hard to pull. Bob tried and tried, but the radish would not move.
Then, a big bird came down to help Bob. The bird pulled and pulled, and the radish came out of the ground. But, it was not a radish! It was a big, red ball! Bob and the bird laughed and played with the ball. They had fun and forgot all about the radish.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Timmy. He wanted to go to the circus very badly. His mommy said he needed a ticket to get in. Timmy did not have a ticket, but he really wanted to go. 
So, Timmy went to the circus and tried to get in without a ticket. The man at the door said he could not come in without a ticket. Timmy felt sad and started to cry. 
But then, a kind lady saw Timmy crying and gave him a ticket. Timmy was so happy! He went into the circus and saw all the amazing animals and acrobats. He had so much fun and was very grateful for the kind lady who gave him the ticket. The end.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a girl named Mia. Mia had a new toy that could glow. She loved her toy and took it everywhere she went.
One day, Mia's dad went to work. Mia wanted to show her glowing toy to her dad. So she ran to the work place and said, "Dad, look at my new toy!" Her dad looked at the toy and smiled. "Wow, Mia! It can glow! That's so cool!" he said.
Mia was very happy that her dad liked her new toy. She played with it all day, and it glowed brightly. At night, she put the toy next to her bed and it glowed softly, helping her sleep. Mia and her glowing toy were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a woman who loved to sail. One day, she was very tired but wanted to sail her boat. She put on her hat and went to the water with her boat. The sun was shining, and the sky was blue. She was very happy to sail.
As she sailed, she saw a big fish jump out of the water. The fish was very big and shiny. The woman was so surprised! She had never seen a fish like that before. She wanted to see more of the big fish. She sailed closer to the fish.
But then, something unexpected happened. The big fish turned into a beautiful bird! The bird was very colorful and could talk. The woman was very happy to meet the bird. They became good friends and sailed together. The woman was not tired anymore. They had a lot of fun sailing under the sun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to take naps, especially when he was feeling tired. One day, Timmy's mom told him that they were going to visit his grandma's house. Timmy was excited because he loved his grandma's cookies.
When they arrived, Timmy noticed that something was different. His grandma's house smelled really smelly, like something was burning. Timmy asked his mom what the smell was, and she told him that his grandma was cooking something new.
After eating some cookies, Timmy decided to take a nap on the couch. But just as he closed his eyes, he heard his grandma shout, "Oh no, the oven is getting too hot!" Suddenly, the temperature increased and smoke started coming out of the oven. Timmy woke up, feeling scared.
But then something unexpected happened. Timmy's grandma opened the oven, and out came a beautiful cake! Timmy was so happy and surprised. He couldn't wait to taste it. From that day on, Timmy always looked forward to visiting his grandma's house for her delicious and unexpected treats.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy tank. He would spend hours making it drive around and pretending it was fighting bad guys.
One day, Timmy's mom told him they were going on a trip. Timmy was excited but also a little nervous because it was going to be a long drive. They got in the car and started driving. Timmy looked out the window and saw lots of trees and houses. He wondered how far away they were from home.
After a while, Timmy saw a big sign that said "Welcome to the beach!" He was so happy because he loved the beach. They parked the car and went to the sand. Timmy played with his toy tank in the sand and had so much fun. He was happy they had spent the day at the beach.

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog is black and white. The dog has a vest. The vest is red and says "help".
"Wow, look at the dog!" Tom says. "He is so big and nice. Can we pet him?"
Lily shakes her head. "No, Tom. We can't. The dog is working. He is a help dog. He helps people who can't see. He prevents them from getting hurt."
Tom is sad. He wants to pet the dog. He likes dogs. He thinks the dog likes him too. The dog wags his tail and looks at Tom.
"Please, Lily. Just one pet. The dog won't mind. He is friendly."
Lily is firm. "No, Tom. You can't. It is not polite. The dog has a job. He has to pay attention to his person. If you pet him, you might distract him. Then he can't help his person. His person might get hurt. You don't want that, do you?"
Tom thinks. He doesn't want that. He doesn't want anyone to get hurt. He wants to be a good friend. He nods. "You are right, Lily. I can't pet the dog. I will wait. Maybe another day, I will see a dog that I can pet. A dog that is not working. A dog that is just playing."
Lily smiles. "That's a good idea, Tom. Come on, let's go play on the swings. Maybe we will see a bird or a squirrel. They are fun to watch too."
Tom and Lily run to the swings. They have fun. They forget about the dog. They are happy.

Tim and Mia are friends. They like to play at the park. The park has a big metal slide. The slide is colorful. It has red, blue, yellow and green parts.
One day, Tim and Mia go to the park with their moms. They run to the slide. They want to climb to the top and slide down. But there is a problem. The slide is too hot. The sun makes the metal hot. Tim and Mia touch the slide and say "Ouch!"
"Tim, Mia, be careful!" their moms say. "The slide is hot. You can get hurt. Why don't you play with something else?"
Tim and Mia look around. They see a swing, a seesaw, a sandbox and a monkey bar. They think for a moment. Then they have an idea.
"Let's play with the monkey bar!" Tim says. "The monkey bar is not hot. It is cool and fun. We can climb and hang like monkeys."
"Good idea!" Mia says. "I like monkeys. They are funny and cute. Let's go!"
Tim and Mia run to the monkey bar. They take turns to climb and hang. They make monkey sounds. They laugh and have fun. Their moms watch them and smile. They are happy that Tim and Mia are safe and happy.

Anna and Ben were twins. They liked to play outside in the garden. One day, they saw a big box near the gate. It had many things inside: ribbons, stickers, paints, and brushes.
"Look, Ben! We can decorate the gate!" Anna said.
"Yes, let's make it pretty!" Ben agreed.
They took out the things from the box and started to decorate the gate. They painted it with different colors. They stuck stickers of animals and flowers on it. They tied ribbons around it. They had a lot of fun.
Soon, the gate looked very different. It was bright and colorful. It had many patterns and shapes on it.
"Wow, we did a good job!" Anna said.
"I like our gate!" Ben said.
They heard their mom calling them from the house.
"Anna, Ben, come inside! It's time for lunch!"
They ran to the house, but not before they looked back at their gate.
"Our gate is the best!" they said together.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old man who lived in a big house. He did not like anyone to come near his house. One day, a little girl came by with a rag in her hand. The old man was so grumpy that he did not permit the little girl to come close to his house. The little girl was sad and walked away. Later that day, the old man felt bad for being so grumpy and went to find the little girl. He found her sitting by the river and gave her permission to come to his house. They became good friends and the old man was no longer grumpy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a favorite bathrobe that he wore every night before bed. One day, Timmy's sister, Sarah, was being very naughty and wouldn't share her toys with him. Timmy was sad and didn't know what to do.
But then, Timmy had an idea. He challenged Sarah to a game of hide and seek. If he found her first, she had to share her toys. Sarah agreed to the game.
Timmy searched high and low, and finally found Sarah hiding behind the couch. He had won the game! Sarah kept her promise and shared her toys with Timmy. And as a reward, Timmy got to wear his favorite bathrobe for the rest of the night. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer who had a bunny. The bunny liked to hop all day. One day, it was icy outside, and the farmer said, "Bunny, be careful when you hop today."
Bunny went outside and saw his friend, Bird. Bird said, "Bunny, let's play on the icy ground!" Bunny and Bird hopped and flew around, but they were very careful.
After a while, the sun came out and the icy ground went away. The farmer saw Bunny and Bird playing and smiled. He said, "Good job, Bunny and Bird, for being careful on the icy ground." Bunny and Bird were happy, and they played until it was time to go home.

One day, a big dog and a little cat were playing outside. They saw a huge tree with a lot of pretty birds. The dog and cat wanted to talk to the birds, so they went to the tree.
The dog said, "Hi birds, let's discuss the thief we saw yesterday." The birds were scared and flew away. The dog and cat felt sad, but they kept talking about the thief.
Later, the thief came back. He was big and scary. The dog and cat were scared too. They tried to run away, but the thief caught them. The dog and cat were very sad, and they could not play anymore. The end.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to run and jump and slide on the grass. They saw a big tree with many twigs on the ground. Lily picked up a twig and threw it in the air. She laughed as it spun and fell.
"Look, Ben, I can throw a twig!" she said.
Ben smiled and picked up a twig too. He threw it as hard as he could. It flew far and fast. It hit a bird that was sitting on a branch. The bird squawked and flew away.
"Oops, sorry, bird!" Ben said.
Lily and Ben felt bad. They did not want to hurt the bird. They wanted to be kind to animals. They decided to stop throwing twigs and find another game to play.
They saw a pond with ducks and fish. They walked to the pond and sat on the edge. They watched the ducks swim and the fish splash. They threw some bread crumbs for them to eat. The ducks quacked and the fish nibbled. Lily and Ben smiled and clapped.
"Look, Ben, we can feed the ducks and the fish!" she said.
Ben nodded and threw some more bread crumbs. He said, "Yes, Lily, we can. This is a peaceful game. We are not hurting anyone. We are making friends."
Lily and Ben felt happy. They liked to play peaceful games. They liked to be friends with animals. They stayed at the pond until it was time to go home. They waved goodbye to the ducks and the fish. They held hands and walked with their mom. They had a fun day in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little birdie. The birdie was very small and fragile. It lived in a cozy nest in a big tree. One day, the birdie woke up early in the morning. It chirped and sang a beautiful song. The birdie was happy to have a new day to explore. It flew out of its nest and saw many pretty flowers and trees. The birdie had so much fun flying and exploring. When the sun went down, the birdie went back to its nest and fell asleep. It was a happy day for the little birdie. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and look at the flowers. One day, she went for a walk in the forest. It was a gloomy day and the trees looked sad. 
Suddenly, she saw a little bunny. The bunny looked scared and Lily wanted to help. She said, "Don't be afraid, little bunny. I won't hurt you." The bunny looked at her and then moved closer. 
Lily was happy that she made a new friend. She asked the bunny, "Do you want to play with me?" The bunny nodded and they played together for a long time. When it was time to go home, Lily said goodbye to the bunny and promised to come back and play again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy who loved to play with his toys. One day, he heard his mom talking on the phone about going on a trip to a new place. Timmy asked his mom if he could come too, but she said he was too little to go on a big trip.
Timmy was sad, but he didn't give up. He asked his dad if he could come, and his dad said he could if he was a good boy and helped pack his things. Timmy was so happy he started to jump up and down. He packed his toys and his favorite blanket.
The next day, they went on the trip to a charming little town. Timmy saw lots of new things and had so much fun. He even got to try new foods and see a parade. When they got home, Timmy told his mom all about the trip and how much fun he had. His mom was happy that his dad allowed him to come and see a new nation.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to help his mommy in the kitchen. One day, his mommy asked him to stir the soup on the stove. Timmy was so excited to help! He grabbed the big spoon and stirred the soup round and round.
Suddenly, Timmy's mommy got a phone call. She had to go to a lecture at work. Timmy didn't want his mommy to go, but she promised she would be back soon. Timmy felt sad and deep down inside he wished his mommy could stay with him.
But then, Timmy had an idea. He asked his mommy if he could go to the lecture with her. His mommy was surprised but happy that Timmy wanted to come. So, they went to the lecture together and Timmy learned lots of new things. When they got home, Timmy helped his mommy make dinner and they stirred the soup together. Timmy felt happy and loved spending time with his mommy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little monkey named Momo. Momo loved to climb trees all day. He was very good at it. Momo had many friends, but he was also competitive. He always wanted to be the best at climbing.
One day, Momo and his friends had a race to see who could climb the tallest tree the fastest. Momo was excited and ready to win. As they started the race, Momo climbed higher and higher. He was ahead of all his friends.
But then, Momo saw a bright red fruit on a branch. He didn't know that it was poison. Momo wanted to eat it. His friend, Lulu the bird, saw the fruit too. Lulu knew it was bad and quickly flew up to Momo. She told him not to eat it. Momo listened and didn't eat the poison fruit. He continued to climb and won the race. Momo was happy, and he thanked Lulu for helping him stay safe.

Once upon a time, there was a cold land. In this cold land, there was a princess. The princess had a big, warm heart. She loved to spend time with her friends. One day, she met a little bird.
"Hi, bird!" said the princess. "I am cold. Are you cold too?"
"Yes, I am cold," said the bird. "But we can be warm together."
So, the princess and the bird spent time together. They played games and sang songs. The cold land became a little warmer because of their fun.
Soon, more friends joined the princess and the bird. They all spent time together, and the cold land became warm and happy. The princess, the bird, and their friends were never cold again.

Once upon a time, there was a nice girl named Amy. She had a small garden where she grew lots of fruits. One day, she found a big prune on a tree. She was very happy.
Amy wanted to show the prune to her friend, Tim. She ran to his house and shouted, "Tim, come see my big prune!" Tim came out and looked at the prune. He was very excited too.
Amy and Tim shared the prune. They both thought it was very yummy. They played in the garden all day, and they were very happy. From that day on, they always looked for big prunes together.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a sunflower seed. She decided to throw it in her garden. Mia thought, "I hope this sunflower seed grows big and strong!" Every day, she gave the seed water and love.
Soon, the sunflower grew very tall. It was the most popular flower in the garden. All the kids in the neighborhood came to see it. One day, her friend Tom came over and said, "Wow, Mia! Your sunflower is so big and pretty!"
Mia was happy that everyone liked her sunflower. She thought about the love and care she gave to the seed. Mia learned that when you take care of something and give it love, it can grow into something beautiful.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a boy named Tom. Tom had a toy car. It was a very dirty car. He loved his toy car, but he wanted it to look nice and clean.
One day, Tom's mom gave him a surprise. She gave him a soft cloth to polish his toy car. Tom was very happy. He said, "Thank you, Mom!" He took the cloth and started to polish the car. He rubbed the car with the cloth until it was clean and shiny.
Tom played with his clean toy car all day long. He showed it to his friend, Sam. Sam said, "Wow, your car looks so nice now!" Tom smiled and said, "Yes, I polished it!" They played together with the toy car, and they had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate dog named Max. Max loved to help his friends. One day, Max saw a little bird that was sad. The bird did not have any food.
Max went to his house and found a bowl. He filled the bowl with bird food. Then, Max carried the bowl in his mouth to the little bird. Max put the bowl down and said, "Here you go, little bird!"
The little bird looked at Max and said, "Thank you, Max!" The bird ate the food from the bowl. The bird was very happy. Max was happy too. They became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play hide and seek with her friends. One day, Lily was playing and she got very hot. She went inside her house to cool down. She saw her curtains and decided to close them. But the curtains were uncomfortable, so she decided to reverse them. 
As she was reversing the curtains, she heard a loud noise outside. She went outside to see what was happening. She saw that her friend had fallen off his bike and was hurt. She quickly ran to him and helped him up. She took him inside and made him feel better. 
After that, Lily's friend felt much better. He thanked her for helping him and they continued to play together. Lily was happy that she could help her friend and she was also happy that she had reversed her uncomfortable curtains.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and she was always excited to explore the world outside her home. So one day, she asked her mom if she could go outside and pick some flowers.
Her mom hesitated and said, “It might be dangerous. I’m worried about you.” She had heard some stories about strangers giving candy to kids, so Sarah’s mom was worried about the the possibility of Sarah being taken away by some ignorant people.
Sarah begged her mom to let her go. After a long negotiation, Sarah’s mom finally agreed on the condition that Sarah had to stay close to the house and not talk to strangers.
After promising her mom, Sarah went out to explore. She picked flowers and sang songs, feeling quite happy and safe. She did not know that there was a stranger secretly following her.
The stranger approached Sarah, smiling, and said to her, “Would you like some candy?” Sarah smiled back but before she could answer, the stranger grabbed her and ran away!
Sarah was never seen again. Her mom was so worried and she never stopped looking for Sarah. Unfortunately she never found her and Sarah might still be lost somewhere in the world.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite button that she loved to press. It was shiny and red, but one day it became dull and gray. She was sad and didn't know what to do. 
Then, she remembered her mommy telling her that when she's feeling sad, she should take a nap. So, she went to her bed and closed her eyes. She slept for a long time and when she woke up, she felt much better. 
She went back to her button and pressed it again. To her surprise, it became shiny and red once more! Lily was so happy and realized that sometimes things just need a little rest to become better again.

Once upon a time, there was a little ant who was very busy all day long. The ant always ran around and never stopped to relax. One day, it started to rain and the ant got very wet. It became very sad because it didn't like being wet.
The ant decided to find a dry place to stay. It looked and looked until it found a cozy little cave. The ant went inside and finally got to relax. It felt very happy and cozy in the dry cave.
The moral of the story is that it's important to take a break and relax sometimes. Even busy ants need to take a break and find a dry place to rest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and color pictures. One day, she found a pair of shiny scissors in her mommy's drawer. They looked interesting to her, so she picked them up and started to cut some paper. 
Suddenly, Lily's mommy called her from the other room. "Lily, can you come here and answer a question for me?" her mommy asked. Lily put down the scissors and ran to her mommy. 
Her mommy asked, "What is your favorite color?" Lily thought for a moment and then answered, "Pink!" Her mommy smiled and gave her a big hug. From that day on, Lily knew that answering questions could be fun too.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy dog named Spot. Spot liked to sleep all day and play with his metal toy. The metal toy was his favorite because it would make a fun noise when he bit it.
One day, Spot's owner put two toys in front of him. One was his metal toy, and the other was a soft, fluffy toy. Spot had to choose which toy he wanted to play with. He looked at both toys and thought about it.
Spot decided to be a good dog and not be lazy today. He chose the soft, fluffy toy to play with because it was new and different. Spot and his owner had a fun day playing with the new toy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go on adventures with her parents. One day, they decided to go camping in the forest. They packed their tent, sleeping bags, and some food.
As they were hiking, Lily saw a little bunny hopping around. She wanted to catch it, but her parents told her not to because it might be scared. Lily felt a little fearful, but her parents held her hand and told her everything would be okay.
When they arrived at their campsite, her parents showed her how to start a fire and cook marshmallows. Lily was so excited to roast her own marshmallow. As they sat around the fire, her parents explained to her how oxygen is important for the fire to keep burning.
After a fun day of hiking and exploring, it was time to go to bed. They packed their things and crawled into their sleeping bags. Lily felt safe and happy, knowing that her parents were there with her in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a mule named Max. Max lived on a farm with other animals. The sun would always shine bright in the sky, making Max happy. One day, Max saw a big cloud. He knew that the sun would soon hide.
Max told his friend, the cow, "The sun will go away soon. It will be dark and not bright." The cow did not believe Max. She said, "No, the sun will keep shining. It is always bright."
But Max was right. The sun went behind the big cloud, and it became dark. The animals on the farm were scared. Max knew what to do. He had an idea to make the farm bright again.
Max found a big flashlight. He turned it on, and it made the farm bright again. The animals were very happy. Max said, "Now we can see and play, even when the sun is hiding." The cow thanked Max for making the farm bright again. From that day on, Max was known as the smart mule who knew how to make things bright.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy man. He liked to raise pumpkins in his garden. One day, a little boy saw the pumpkins and wanted one.
The little boy said, "Please, can I have a pumpkin?" The grumpy man said, "No, you cannot have a pumpkin. They are mine."
The little boy was sad. He went away and found a big stick. He came back and hit the pumpkins with the stick. The pumpkins broke.
The grumpy man was very mad. He chased the little boy. The little boy ran away fast. He did not see the big hole in the ground. The little boy fell in the hole.
